Reviews.Title: Great camera - so I thought
Reviews.Author: Ronald D. Hubbs
Reviews.Content: I needed a good camera and didn't want to spend a lot of coin.  I picked this one b/c it had the lithium-ion rechargeable battery and was 10 megapixel.  It's super easy to use and has great features.  I have taken some close ups of things (macro) and I'm blown away by the detail quality.  For [...] bucks, I don't know how you could beat this.  Some of the shots i've taken already look professional and I don't even really know how to fully use it yet.Great buy.THE ABOVE WAS MY ORIGINAL REVIEW.  BELOW IS THE UPDATE:This camera seemed fine for me at the time, but despite VERY LIGHT USE and always having it in a protective case and proper handling, it didn't even last a year and a half.  The lens wouldn't open and despite several attempts to fix it (using various methods found online as this is a common problem), nothing worked.  My option was to try to get it fixed for more than the camera is worth.  Now it is a $150 paper weight.  Complete junk.Bought a Canon PowerShot SX130 IS and am far happier:  better pics, better video, easier to use.  For lower end stuff like this, I would go with Canon.  While Nikon may make great high end cameras, their consumer grade stuff seems like junk.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: John Hayden
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera a little over a year and have not been impressed with the picture quality.  For the price, however, it was tolerable.  Now the lens cover is stuck (the infamous "lens error").  No luck trying to fix it myself and it will cost more for someone to fix it than it is worth.  These cameras tend to have this lens problem.  Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Overall Just Okay
Reviews.Author: Jared L. Hardy
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to say because I didn't have high expectations.  I was looking for a coolpix to replace the one I previously had.  However, I definitely liked my older model better, despite the new one's sleek,  modern look.  It's less user friendly making the various settings harder to switch.  Also the camera's lcd screen has poor quality.  When the pictures are loaded onto your computer they look okay, but when you're taking the picture there are green spots and people are a bit washed out.  It works fine for me because I only wanted to cheap point and shoot to carry around with me wherever I go, but I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased...
Reviews.Author: A. Campla "ames<3"
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with this camera as a gift about two weeks ago, and I love it! It takes great pictures once you get used to using all the settings. Like many others have said in their reviews, this is not an out of the box camera. You need to learn about the settings in order to get great pictures. The camera is certainly capable of great pictures, just take the time (it doesn't take all that long) to get familiar with your camera's abilities and you'll love it! And the color is BEAUTIFUL! I even found a camera case on Amazon that practically matches the camera! Yes, I am a blessed and happy wifey :)

Reviews.Title: Worst piece of crap I've ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: I should have known better because every time I go to Staples there are about 5 of these cameras that were returned on the "bargain table". Now I know why.As a lifelong Nikon customer and former professional photographer, I can tell you that anyone who says this is a great camera is just plain ignorant or works for Nikon.This piece of crap cannot handle any lighting conditions, and I mean ANY lighting conditions. If it's too dark, both videos and stills are incredibly grainy, and the color reproduction is absolutely horrendous! Use the flash, and everything is washed out. If there is lots of light, it's STILL too grainy, colors are saturated to the point of looking like cartoons, and edges are broken up instead of solid lines. This is with all settings on "Auto". I tried "Manual" with the same results.The videos have lines and streaks throughout, and constant shifting colors in sunlight. I took a video in a park and half the grass and sky are YELLOW and the entire video has vertical lines running through it! My CELLPHONE takes better videos! 90% of the videos I took at a local water park are unuseable. The distortion (because the light is too bright) and grain makes it look like a kid's toy camera took the vids.Although they claim 10 Megapixels, I had a 1.3 Megapixel Olympus that took much, MUCH better pictures. I guarantee you will see ultra-saturated, runny colors, graininess that rivals most cellphones, and unbelievably poor edge definition.The "features" such as "smile detection" are just stupid! If you're too dumb to know when someone is smiling then you have no business owning a camera.I am so sorry I waited so long to test this thing! Now I can't take it back and I wouldn't have the heart to pawn it off on some other poor sucker. I can't emphasize enough what a waste of money this thing is.

Reviews.Title: Cool Digital Camera for Beginners
Reviews.Author: Bryan Carey "Bryan Carey"
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S220 Digital Camera is a compact digital camera that makes a good camera choice for the first- time digital camera owner who is ready to get started in the world of digital photography but wants something that isn't priced too high or requires too much tech savvy. It is one of the smaller cameras available and it is offered at a price level that makes it ideal for the budget- minded consumer.Digital cameras are offered in many sizes and with many features and the Nikon Coolpix S220 Digital Camera is easily the smallest digital camera I have ever used. There are some cameras that are even smaller, but most are inadequate for my needs, due to their often tiny LCD viewing screen.  This camera offers an LCD screen that is large enough to easily see what you need to see so that picture taking is optimized. The size is sufficient enough that it doesn't hinder the taking of quality pictures.Picture quality is the most important feature of any digital camera and the Nikon Coolpix S220 Digital Camera does, indeed, take good pictures for a simpler camera. It also includes helpful features that produce better photographs, such as its image stabilization system. I also like the color options. Standard color is the option most photographers will use, but there is also a setting called Vivid Color. This option brightens the colors and in many ways, it reminds me of the colors common to a videotaped television program. However, one needs to be careful with this feature because I have found that it sometimes distorts the colors in certain situations. For example, outdoor pictures should not be taken using the Vivid Color option because it can result in a level of color that is a little unrealistic.Another picture taking aid with this camera is its Smart Portrait system. This includes features such as Smile Mode, which automatically snaps the picture when the subject is smiling; Built- in blink proofing, which snaps two pictures and deletes one of them if eyes are blinking; Face- Priority technology, which focuses quickly on faces and adjusts brightness so that faces look more natural; etc. These features are nice, but not always reliable. I have found, for example, that the blink- prevention feature doesn't always work. Sometimes, pictures get snapped anyway with the eyes of the subject shut. Of course, one can easily delete the picture and try again, but it would be nice if this technology was more predictable.The Nikon Coolpix S220 Digital Camera is a small digital camera, so it fits easily into one's shirt pocket or other small space. This is generally good, but it can also prove to be a problem. Because it is so small, it is easy to lose this camera. A camera this small and thin can fit into many places where other cameras will not fit, so you need to be careful where you leave it.Nikon makes some very good digital cameras and they also make a few average cameras. Nikon Coolpix S220 Digital Camera fits into the latter category. It is a good point and shoot digital camera, but it lacks the sophistication of other cameras and some of its features are inconsistent. Still, it's a decent beginner's camera and its small size and 10 megapixels make it a good choice for those new to the world of digital .

Reviews.Title: Great value for a good camera.
Reviews.Author: Joe F. "JoeF9000"
Reviews.Content: My Nikon S220 is a good camera. It is not, the $7000 digital Professional SLR.It is simply a very easy to use, very resaonably priced, point & shoot camera. I feel that I received exactly the camera I needed for my application at the price I was willing to pay. I particularly like the simple controls.Overall - I considered physical size, megapixel rating, functionality, ease of use, and quality of images obtained - and then gave it a 5 Star rating.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Kelly Andretta
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I got this camera. It's small...but easy to use. The photo's I've taken so far have been great. It's point and shoot..but has features you can set to take specific photos..like beach, portrait, and night scene. It even has a panoramic setting . It also takes short videos. It's alot of bang for the buck. I bought it in plum and it's very pretty. Not as bright as in the photos. Great as a every day camera..I'm so very pleased!

Reviews.Title: I'm very disappointed with this camera
Reviews.Author: Teresa DownUnder "TDU"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I used to own an entry level Nikon Coolpix L10 5MP camera which made beautiful pictures. I was so happy with my old Nikon that when it accidently broke I wanted to stick with the brand so I bought a slightly better model.Unfortunately when I tried the camera I was horrified at the quality of the pictures. Pictures are blurry, soft, kind of foggy. I tried different settings, low ISO, natural light, flash, you name it. There's no crispness about them. The pictures this camera takes don't even look good on the LCD screen at the back of the camera!I was so unhappy I returned the camera first thing today and got a Canon IXUS 80IS which takes nice crispy photos.I still don't understand how the same company could produce a Nikon camera which cost me $80 2 years ago and took such terrific pictures out of the box with great crispness and great colours under many different conditions. Then 2 years later, another Nikon, twice as expensive as the first one, can produce photos of the same quality a disposable camera would. What went wrong in the process to get this camera out? Didn't anyone at Nikon realise this camera was going to be a failure?It may look compact, have nice features, but I would have thought picture quality was essential. If the picture quality is bad, forget it.

Reviews.Title: Impossible to get good shots consistently
Reviews.Author: David F. Garcia "Davigan"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it had every feature I was looking for for candid child shots: right size, video capability, face focus. Unfortunately, after struggling with it for 6 weeks I returned it, since it's almost impossible to consistently take decent shots without a ton of digital noise (speckles / grain in the shot). My big clunky 10 year old Cannon G-shot takes far superior photos. Even my little Casio Exilim, which occasionally has focus issues, and which I bought the Nikon to replace, is way better. The Coolpix shots look a bit like those from my 7-year old's kid camera. There's no way I can use most of the photos I took, either on the auto settings, or when I tried to adjust them manually. Interestingly enough, when I took it back to Costco where I bought it, the camera guy checking in the return told me (quite casually), "Oh yes, these are awful cameras." Don't waste your time & money.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: C. Link "world traveler"
Reviews.Content: THis is a great camera.  I was looking for a good camera for taking pics in the dark at concerts, etc.  It has so many different modes but it is so easy to use!  It has a great shutter speed and is so user friendly.  A great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: WHAT A GORGEOUS CAMERA & IT TAKES GORGEOUS PICTURES!
Reviews.Author: E. Miller
Reviews.Content: I too was very hesitant on purchasing this camera because of all of the negative reviews.  I just couldn't accept the fact that a company such as Nikon would sell "crap".  I did a lot of research and read just about all of the reviews I could find and noticed that most of the reviews had two things in common.  The pictures were "grainy and blurry".  I took the advice of some of the reviewers and lowered the ISO settings to 80 before I used the camera.  I am proud to say that I am exceedingly satisfied with my gorgeous Plum Nikon.  People, instead of just opening the box and taking photos, please, please READ THE MANUAL.

Reviews.Title: LCD Screen Died
Reviews.Author: hendrikjs
Reviews.Content: I took approx 500 shots with and the LCD screen died on me. Estimated cost of repair from Nikon (this was not covered under warranty) was $90. Hardly worth it. I would not buy this product again.

Reviews.Title: Good camera if size and features are important
Reviews.Author: Flaherty
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughters birthday and was really surprised at how small it was compared to the other digital cameras in our household. It is by far the smallest and lightest camera, yet it is packed with features.The camera is less than 3/4 of an inch thick, only 3.5" wide, and 2" high. The controls are super easy to understand. With the battery and SD card installed it weighed in at only 4.1 ounces, about half the weight of my my Canon digital camera I bought earlier this year. Comparing the two side by side, the Canon is twice as thick.One way the weight and size is being reduced on the Nikon is they use aspecial rechargeable battery, the Nikon EN-EL10 Lithium-ion Battery for Nikon Coolpix S600, S520 & S210, or the generic equivalent being the Maximalpower DB OLY LI40B/42B Rechargeable Li-Ion Battery for Olympus Li-40B,Li-42B, Kodak KLIC7006,FUJI NP45, Nikon EN-EL10,Pentax D-Li63. The battery is not quite as convenient as AA's, but it does save on the weight and is conveniently rechargeable.I found the camera did an excellent with outdoor shots, even when using the zoom lens at its maximum power. However, indoors the camera did not handle indoor photos as well as the Canon. The pictures were still pretty good, just not as good as I was getting with the other camera.The camera comes with 44 MB of internal memory, which allowed me to take 28 pictures at 10 mp before needing an SD card.Two really cool features on this camera are the panorama assist which allows you to take pieces of a panoramic picture by overlapping your last shot so you can take consecutive shots and join them together later in the included Panorama Maker which is included with the software CD.Another interesting feature is the Best Shot Selector. When this is selected, the camera will rapidly take 10 photos, and automatically save the sharpest one. The only downside is that I would like to review the 10 pictures and personally select the one I like the best.The camera can use up to a 16 GB SDHC card. Surprisingly, for it's small size, it also has a tripod mount.If you're looking for a lightweight camera that is big on features and low in price, this might be the perfect camera for you. It also comes in a variety of fun colors such as red, magenta, blue, green, black, and silver.I would also recommend ordering the Transcend 4 GB SDHC Class 6 Flash Memory Card TS4GSDHC6E [Amazon Frustration-Free Packaging] , which will hold hundreds of photos.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S220
Reviews.Author: C. Bottomley
Reviews.Content: This is an ultra-compact camera, great to have with you while travelling while not taking up too much space. The zoom works great and picture quality is reasonable (though not the best). My only issue with this camera was the battery life; I tried two different batteries over the course of a few months and both depleted quite rapidly.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Francesca M. Whitcomb
Reviews.Content: I aboslutely love this product! It's perfect for any camera-lovers who don't know exactly what they're doing. It's easy and simple, but comes with a lot of awesome features.

Reviews.Title: Don't Bother-- Not Worth Price
Reviews.Author: ragamuffin
Reviews.Content: If you are used to any quality of pictures at all, I'd skip this one. The pictures on the view show up with red and green spots and when you load them onto your computer they aren't much better. Ashton Kutcher, I feel so let down by you.I am returning mine.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix s220
Reviews.Author: Grace
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter in blue for her birthday and she immediately loved the color and the size of the camera.  The problem was the picture and the video quality.  The pictures were coming out grainy and showed up with rainbow dots.  The video she took had visible pink stripes and also rainbow dots showing up.  I was not satisfied with this camera, so I returned it within a few days.  I was surprised that this camera had poor image quality since it is 10 MP and made by Nikon.  I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Customize your settings!
Reviews.Author: J. Ludwick
Reviews.Content: I picked this (S220) up on sale at a local brick & mortar store and am quite happy with it.  What others here are complaining about in terms of picture quality, or lack of, can easily be corrected by referring to your User's Manual (p.93)!  In 'Auto' mode go to 'Menu' and 'Image Mode' to select 'High (3648*)' for even better quality photos.  ('10m*' should then show in your monitor window during shooting, lower right).  This mode will use up much more memory on your memory card due to increasing compression ratio, though it's worth every pixel.  Set ISO to '80' and Color options to 'Vivid' (B&W; is fun too).  Hope this helps.Really, this teeny little point & shoot camera does very well for it's size and price, which is why I bought it... to shove in my pocket, toss in my purse, and/or to let my kids use.  Both video and photos transfer to my laptop effortlessly.Rating is 4 stars.  A -.5 as this camera is not optimal out-of-the-box with factory settings and only marginally better when customized.  Another -.5 for shutter lag in well-lit conditions.

Reviews.Title: Good Looks, TERRIBLE PICTURES!!!
Reviews.Author: Richard D. Shewmaker
Reviews.Content: This is a very beutiful & attractive camera it is easy to use and has a reasonable level of features but as far as its original purpose it is terrible, the picture quality is TERRIBLE!!! Do not buy this camera unless you like low quality pics or are blind. Also NIKKON tech support as far as rectifying the very low quality picture issues will not work with you.  All I have to say is stay away.

Reviews.Title: This is a Good Camera
Reviews.Author: PKB
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera.  It takes good pictures and is easy to use.  I am stunned to read some of the reviews here -- it's like night and day with my experiences.  I am thinking they are reviewing the s230 which is really bad and gets bad reviews everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Eila F. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I love this camera -- especially its size and weight.  I wanted a small camera that I could just "aim and shoot" and this camera works for me.  Don't be fooled, however, this camera is loaded with many features that are popular today.

Reviews.Title: Last resort camera....
Reviews.Author: Etienne
Reviews.Content: And by last resort, I mean if your backup camera is broken, and you don't have your cellphone with you, this piece of garbage will do. 6 out of 119 pictures I took were high quality, and presentable. The other 113 went into the trash. The macro settings are terrible; You will always need keep it in full force zoom. Micro settings are fine, but you can't be any further than 3 feet away from the subject. Don't bother turning the flash off. You'll get distorted, infared looking photos that look like they were taken in 1920. The 6 decent pictures I got were outdoors in beaming sunlight with the flash on and the closest zoom possible. And even then the results were erratic. You will see very little improvement, if any, with the "enhanced" settings maxed out. Awful, simply awful. A real embarrassment to Nikon, and is only selling because of the brand name. I don't get what people see in this series, and I would avoid it at all costs.The ONE positive thing I can say about it is the battery life is good. It's worth more than the camera itself. This camera is a waste of money, and I would feel bad reselling it to someone who didn't know any better. Not worth more than $20.00 unopened. This camera will do one of two things: Destroy your faith in Nikon, or send you back to the store demanding a refund with a tantrum. Hopefully you'll at least do the latter. Dig deeper, and go with a 12 MP with at least a 4X zoom. Kodak beat this by a longshot. I'd even recommend a 3 MP camera over this.I wish I had read these reviews before buying this. Having more 1-star ratings than 5-star should be a fair warning.

Reviews.Title: Worst nikon I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from a Staples near me a little over a year ago.  I have an SLR and was looking for something compact and light to take on vacation.  From day 1 it's never worked right.  It refuses to take still pictures in bright light, even though it'll shoot video in the same light conditions.  Almost everything comes out blurry.  I'm not a beginner camera user, but for point and shoot relaibility, I'm horribly disappointed in Nikon.  It's actually so bad I've taken my SD card out and put it back in the box to sell at a yard sale for $10 just to get rid of it.It's slick looking and portable, and fits in a pocket really well.  The screen is great.  The actual camera part is horrendous.  Save your money and buy a different point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Set the ISO to 80, Works Better
Reviews.Author: Sujit Kumar Mahapatra "Sujit"
Reviews.Content: The out-of-box image quality is either blurry or grainy. I tried couple of things and went on-line for a solution. I got that setting the ISO level to 80 helps a lot. The pictures are coming fine when you set the ISO to 80. For this Press the Menu button when you are in picture shooting mode, navigate to the ISO sensitivity and set it to ISO 80. The video quality is excellent in this camera, almost like a camcorder video.

Reviews.Title: Cell phone quality pics
Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: I haven't seen picture quality this bad in years.  Pictures are grainy, splotchy and over-processed.  It makes people's hair look like blotches of melted wax.  While it claims 10 megapixels, the actual resolution is closer to a 1 megapixel cell phone.  There are so many better choices than this camera...for example the Canon SD1200IS.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money!
Reviews.Author: Rachel Weatherby "rose_of_rohan"
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon digital SLR camera so I thought I'd give this a try.  It seemed like it shot okay when I was in the store trying it out, but once I got it home and did some test shots I REALLY wished I hadn't bought it!!  No matter what setting you use (minus the macro setting... it did alright), the pictures are slightly out of focus and grainy.  It pretty much sucks in any lighting and not even the auto setting helps.I wouldn't even recommend this to a beginning photographer.  If you have other choices, don't waste your money on it.  I'm very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Style, Good Size, Good Price, So-so/Poor Image Quality
Reviews.Author: T&T;
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 6 grader daughter to replace her old Kodak 6MP camera. It is very small and stylish. The price is very good too. Actually, it is one of the least expensive brand name digital cameras on the market. (I never understand why those professional or serious photographers would buy this bottom cheap camera, and expect great image quality from it.)On the paper, this camera is great. It is one of the world's smallest cameras. It has 10MP resolution. All-metal case should be very solid. It also has a surprising range of features. It can even detect the smile and blink!The real world image quality is a different story. The picture is soft and lack of details. (I did many test shoots comparing S220 to other point-n-shoot cameras, NOT SLRs.) The corner softness is out of control. And the Barrel Distortion is crazy. (The camera has an option to correct the Barrel Distortion though.)However, the image color is very good, which will give the user a good first impression. Not all users are Pixel-Peeper. So for average normal users who want style and portability, and normally view the pictures on computer screen or print 4x6s, S220 is not a bad choice at all.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this, trust me!
Reviews.Author: Kelly Foley Sapio
Reviews.Content: As a serious photographer I have used many cameras, this has to be the worst!!! All the pictures are grainy or washed out. Half the pictures you take are very blurry and are unusable! The camera takes a long while to turn on and the grainy feel to it makes you feel SO dizzy! But another camera this isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Image Quality - Do NOT Buy This Camera!
Reviews.Author: James A. Coulter
Reviews.Content: Like all the other one-star reviews I was incredibly disappointed in the image quality.  I used an earlier version of the Coolpix and was happy with it, but the S220 is good only for thumbnails.  Anything larger and you're unable to ignore the softness around the image's edges.  It looks like someone smeared petroleum jelly around the lens.  Do not buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera for on the go lifestyle
Reviews.Author: Deirdre O'Kane "nanakane"
Reviews.Content: This camera fits in a pocket or purse and takes great photos wherever you find yourself. It is perfect for an active lifestyle where excessive size is a problem. Clear, crisp images each time.By the way, it was supposed to have five stars, but I can't seem to edit the rating. It is easier to edit the photos.

Reviews.Title: No Memory Card Included!
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Don't forget to purchase a memory card that is compatible with the camera. I tried to use a card from another device and it wasn't compatible. Do the research first for the make and model of the camera and add it into the purchase. Other wise the internal memory only allows for approximately 10 to 12 pics.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Katie Whitney
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It works so great and the picture quality is amazing! My favorite part is being able to crop the pictures to make new pictures!

Reviews.Title: Why did I put up with the S220 for 8 months?
Reviews.Author: ExNikonOwner "S220"
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to find a Nikon in such a small package (I have owned 4 Nikon Coolpix cameras).  But the image quality rates a ZERO. (This review did not allow that rating.)  My first 2mp camera had better sharpness.  When I called Nikon to complain they said to send it in for reconfiguration!  When I called he store they said to drop it and take advantage of my protection plan!If you own one call Nikon, if you are thinking of buying one, buy a Canon SD780... I did.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Caitie
Reviews.Content: I'll admit it, I got this camera because it was cheap and pretty. As far as looks go, I'm pretty smitten with it. The lcd is large and crisp, the controls are incredibly user friendly, and it takes wonderful point and shoot pictures. There are a million settings you can use from fireworks to food, but they're mostly kind of useless and don't look much different from the auto function. The photos are generally crisp and accurate, though I've experienced some bizarre color casts. I spent some time in a blacksmith shop, and all the rust came out bright yellow instead of rust-colored, which is not something easy to fix in photoshop. Also, I spend a lot of time with the macro lens, which I've been underwhelmed with. The focus is fairly far away- a good 6 inches, and even from there it's usually blurry by the time I crop it. Otherwise, though, I've been happy with contrast and color vibrancy. It really does do a good job for the price.So all in all, I'd say it's a very appropriate camera for the non-professional without a lot of money. I hate to admit that I fall into the group of consumers that buy something because it looks pretty, but if that's one of your requirements-go for it. This thing is adorable.

Reviews.Title: Camera was broke on arrival
Reviews.Author: Crystal Summers
Reviews.Content: Received a broken camera. Can't really review the camera itself by this but I know the one I used in the past wasn't the best either.

Reviews.Title: It breaks easily!
Reviews.Author: claudiacat
Reviews.Content: I actually liked the camera for the few months it worked. Then, one day, it slipped and I caught it half a second later, so it didn't fall down, just got a shake. It stopped working immediately: the lenses got stuck out, and the screen kept saying "Lens Error." I googled the problem, and it turned out many, many people had the exact same problem with this model. Why didn't I look this up before buying it? The suggested remedy was to give the lens a light tap, and, if it didn't work, a stronger one. Twenty taps later, it started working again for a few minutes, then got stuck again. I am outside the US now, and I don't even want to think what it would take to have it returned/fixed/etc.Don't buy it. Look for something else and do your research.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: B. Adame
Reviews.Content: I've owned a version of this camera before and I'm just as happy with this one.  For what I paid I love it.  It's not a top of the line camera with high quality pictures but it does what I need and I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera .
Reviews.Author: A. Hannon
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use . Good quality pictures ! Reasonable price . Bonus- Rechargeble batteries !

Reviews.Title: cool coolpix
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: The Coolpix camera is the bomb!  I snap photos everywhere and everyway.  It is great and green!

Reviews.Title: Worst Point & Shoot Ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Fatima
Reviews.Content: Worst camera ever, particularly for night pics.  Every picture (even outdoor) comes out blurry unless you have bright lights/sun above you.  I've had Canon P&S; and Casio P&S; and they worked way better than this one.Camera fail.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix 10 mp camera with 2.5" screen
Reviews.Author: Anthony J. Mancini
Reviews.Content: Good overall but in reviewing pictures on your SD card,it does not store them last first, but rather flips you back to the first picture you took which forces you to page through the pictures already taken to get to the most recent ones

Reviews.Title: A good little camera at a good little price!
Reviews.Author: Godmother of the Bride
Reviews.Content: I just wanted an inexpensive, very small camera that will fit in my pocket.  Nothing fancy, just basically a "point and shoot" variety.  The Nikon Coolpix S220 really fits my specs beautifully. I am not very electronically savvy, yet I had no trouble learning how to use it.  I recommend, though, getting a neck lanyard so that you can carry it around your neck - this would make it less likely for you to lose or drop it somewhere.  My only complaint - and it's just a very tiny one - is that without the view finder feature that other cameras have, it is often hard to see the image you're photographing if it is a bright clear day.

Reviews.Title: Gift for teenage daughter
Reviews.Author: Martin K
Reviews.Content: After searching many web sites I decided on this camera.  The Nikon Coolpix S220 had the best reviews and the price was great.  For my teenager I didn't want to spend too much and rick it getting broken or lost. This was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: It doesn't fullfill my expectations!!!
Reviews.Author: Maria Jose Gutierrez "Majos photo"
Reviews.Content: When I bought this point and shoot, I tought I was getting the best for the price, since it's a nikon, but after using it and surf trough all the picture settings I'm a little dissapointed because when using any of the preset scine settings, mostly portrait setting, I get really yellow pictures, I don't mean a little sun tan sort of yellow, I mean really chicken yellow images, faces, background, wites, blacks, everything gets yellow tainted, just horrible... To be honest that did not happend with my previos point and shoot, Kodak Z670, indcredible but true, I don't regreat having buying it.In the bright sight it's really simple to use, the menu and the settings are really friendly, easy access for the iso settings, great wite balances. The body is slick and beutifull, stylish and light wighted, really ergonomic, I bought it because I have a Nikon D40X, wich I love, but my only problem is that is too big and some times is unconfurtable to take it to parties or places where you won't have a lot of room to work with it, so I find my new S220 convinient to solve this problem, as long as I shoot in auto is just perfect.So if someone can give me a hint to solve my yellowish problem, please let me know... I do recomend it, the battery life is great.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: R. M. Miller "rslickm"
Reviews.Content: As a fan of Nikon I knew I wouldn't be disappointed. The perfect little "point & shoot" camera. Graduation gift for daughter heading off to college & she loves it! Not overly complicated as some models can be, simple controls, easy downloading, fast start up and recovery between shots, etc, etc. Adding a screen protector & a 2gb-4gb memory card is a must. Wife (extremely non-tech savvy) liked it so much, now looking for another one for her. For the money, less then $130, and for a simple, small, point & shoot camera, you can't go wrong with this model.

Reviews.Title: Just a Florida Mom
Reviews.Author: Just a Florida Mom
Reviews.Content: Easy to use & even easier to stick in your pocket! I was looking for convenience, something to slip in any sized pocket to capture unexpected moments, not to produce award winnning photos so I'm quite satisfied. It's tiny, but has a good zoom and takes quality photos. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: CRAP!!!
Reviews.Author: K. Bonilla
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Wal-Mart, because I just needed a new camera. I took pretty good pictures but the lens kept getting stuck. One day it got stuck so bad I couldn't even push it back in, so we sent it back to Nikon, thinking this would be covered under warranty. A few weeks later we got a bill in the mail. They wanted $112 to fix the camera! I only paid $115 for the camera. The camera was a cheaply made piece of crap!

Reviews.Title: Ordered a factory reconditioned camera
Reviews.Author: Sherice Acker
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed that the camera arrived and the lens does not work, so I don't think the factory reconditioning worked very well in this case.  I will have to return this product.

Reviews.Title: horrible
Reviews.Author: Jessie
Reviews.Content: got it and after 1 month the think was messed up and with great care always in case exept for the very light use i had only used it for um 10 times i would reccomend NOT to buy this product and i hope this comment was useful to you and god bless

Reviews.Title: upset about product
Reviews.Author: MadMama
Reviews.Content: Well, I don't know i never got to USE the product!!!! I bought it in may, but didn't have a memory card yet, so about 2 months later i got one (im on a tight budget bc im a single mom) and i turn on the camera and it DOESN'T WORK!!!! it just keeps saying "lens error" i contact the seller asking for an exchange of some sort and all they say is sorry, its past the 90 days?! what the heck??? how is that fair at all?! NO WHERE on information does it say the camera is damaged at all...so why do i have put up with an UNUSABLE camera?!

Reviews.Title: I will never buy Nikon again
Reviews.Author: E. Nathan "Zen Knitter"
Reviews.Content: I have had many Nikon camearas over the years and until about 5 years ago, they were stellar.  Now they are junk.  Ive had three small cameras by Nikon and all do the same thing, stop focusing all of a sudden.  When they won't focus, they are essentially junk for the trash can.  I checked this problem out on the internet and it seems to be a major problem with Nikon small cameras.So sad to see this happen to what used to be a quality brand.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Great Quality Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera, at first I thought the photo quality sucked and I bought a rip off, BUT, I changed the ISO settings; exposure settings and got High Quality photos, this isn't a camera that will always right off the bat have good photos where ever you take them. You HAVE to change those settings in order to get good photos.

Reviews.Title: Very compact and feature-rich, but picture quality is terrible !
Reviews.Author: H.L.
Reviews.Content: PROS: lots of features, compact size, feel, controls, most notable feature is the "time laps".CONS: unbelievably poor picture quality.  I was stunned that Nikon was willing to put its name on such crap !!! I know it's low budget camera, but come on !I took about 200 shots in both outdoors and indoors.  The photos all lack sharpness in all settings. This camera is suitable if you want something small to fit in the pocket, but don't expect sharp pix !

Reviews.Title: Overpriced inferior product
Reviews.Author: Lezette Webster
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a year and a half, after taking a recommendation from the guy at Target. It's my first digital camera, but my last NIKON. A company with such a good reputation should not be selling this camera. It's satisfactory for first time users, but as you get usded to the digital thing, the problems stand out - mainly picture quality. I've had three events so far where every shot was blurred, and I stay as still as possible. Feature wise it's good, but with crappy picture quality, all those features are useless. Close up shots and outdoor shots (with no motion) are fine, but indoor shots are grainy and blurry, and it never focuses when you use the zoom. I think the price tage is too high for such poor quality. I bought a Kodak Easyshare for my mom at half this price, and it takes phenomenal pictures, even with motion, they are crisp and clear. Nikon should offer a trade in or something for people who wasted money on this and lost memories of events because of no decent photos to keep!!!

Reviews.Title: Horrible.  :(
Reviews.Author: beanface
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mom and it's the worst camera I've ever used.  It feels very cheap, like if you drop it on the carpet, it will break into many pieces.  The picture quality is the worst!  My cell phone takes better pictures.  ALL PICTURES taken are grainy and just plain bad.  I've checked to make sure all the settings were correct and the megapixel setting is on it's highest.  Maybe this is just a defect, because I sent my awesome Canon camera in to get the lens replaced and it now takes horrible grainy pictures.  So maybe there's something that is faulty.  But judging by the other reviews, it seems like it's a crapshoot.  I wouldn't waste my money on this one.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it! It will break.
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I have purchased three of these cameras for my daughters and all three of them broke in the first year of use. The screen broke on two of them, one in my daughters pocket and the other in her purse, they are ridiculously delicate cameras. The other one just stopped working, the lens froze in the out position. so I sent it in to Nikon because it was still under warranty. I just received the response. They said it was impact damage because it had a small dent in the corner.  I don't know when that dent may have occurred but I don't think that's why the camera didn't work.  It was working fine, I know because I was using it, I had been using it all day and then it stopped working, no impact was involved. Be advised that if something happens to your camera and you send it in to Nikon, make sure it has no scratches or dents, they will make that the cause of your camera malfunction, thus invalidating the warranty.

Reviews.Title: Frequently breaks
Reviews.Author: jshirreff
Reviews.Content: Just google "Nikon Coolpix lens error", and you will get almost 40,000 hits!.  I have had this camera for only 9 months and now it is worthless.  Lens failure is apparently very common with this camera.  It is not durable. Complete waste of $200.  Save your money and do not buy this camera.  The reviews are horrible for a reason.

Reviews.Title: Complete Junk- can I give no stars?
Reviews.Author: Patrick Ahearn "Sporto"
Reviews.Content: Lens error within 3 months and they say it is not covered.  No customer service at all.  If you get someone without a thick accent you may be able to sort of get through the process.  However look on the web and the same story 100% of the time.  Your camera breaks within 6 months you send it to Nikon at your expense and they want $100 to fix a $150.00 camera for a known defect.  This Camera is complete junk and Nikon are total thieves.  READ THE REVIEWS ONLINE BEFORE YOU EVEN THINK ABOUT BUYING THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Affordable but Mediocre
Reviews.Author: Dolly Leigh
Reviews.Content: I was going to give it two stars, but alas, the camera is quite cheap. And so:Automatic adjustments make everything inside appear very red. Don't expect to take nice portraits.Lacks way to fix this auto adjustment easily.Can only edit color settings on auto mode.Short battery life. Cannot charge from computer, either.Screen could be better.Often pixelated.The settings it has are not organized very well.However:PortableCheap"Cute" designDecent with outdoor shotsFor the same price, though, get a better camera. My friend's Kodak Easyshare takes higher quality photos than this one.It is best summed up with the word "mediocre".

Reviews.Title: I HATE this camera
Reviews.Author: Amy Mclaughlin "AmyMcL"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a year ago. It was in my price range and I had a Nikon before so I was familiar with the settings. This is the worst camera I have ever owned!!! Just the other day, I took a few pictures, put the camera down to do something else. I went back to the camera to take a few more pictures and the lens was stuck. I cannot get it to close. Also, this camera takes horrible pictures. I know I am not the best photographer but when the camera says it is in focus and I still get blurry shots....has to be the camera. (Takes nice pictures outdoors in the sunlight though)

Reviews.Title: As expected
Reviews.Author: J. Boeckman
Reviews.Content: Look, if you are thinking about this camera you are not looking high end.  For the price the picture quality is just fine.  We wanted a small camera that is easy to use and will take decent pictures.  This met our needs.  My mom is incredibly confused with simple electronics and even she can take good pictures with ease.  For the money we are quite pleased and would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix S220
Reviews.Author: Sajjad Siddiqi "shs"
Reviews.Content: Very delicate equipment went bad 3 times for me .I will never buy this produc again

Reviews.Title: neat
Reviews.Author: C. Marcellin "amateur photo "bug""
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased as a gift and the recipient has provided the feedback which appears to be favorable.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy the Coolpix S220!
Reviews.Author: Maverick
Reviews.Content: I bought the S220 without doing first any research, because I trusted Nikon (have a great SLR and would not want anything else!) Nice camera good build quality: Nikon. But after taking the first pictures they looked bad an the LCD, so I figured that is just the screen resolution, and that the picture will be OK once downloaded on my PC - but it wasn't. More than half of the picuture taken can be tossed, no matter if inside, outside, close-up, far - the S220 just can't handle it (I have three other small digitals, Pentax, Olympus + Casio some 10 years old and all taking better pictures). I have played with the settings, pixels, etc. nothing improves the picture quality (blurry, heavy grain, not focused, dark or overexposed...)Will I buy a Nikon again - of course, but from now on I will first check the reviews and to some testing first.This camara is not worth even the newest discounted price of $100. Buy another type instead!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: amazon woman
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!!!!!!I got this for my trip to Japan, and love it so much. The pictures are just beautiful- clear and focused with such vivid colors. It's durable, sleek, and takes great pictures. The quality is wonderful, and it's so easy to use.Anyone that gives it a low review is full of it. Come on, it's $100 for a camera that works wonderfully! If you want a camera that takes studio-grade photos, pay the price for one. But this little camera takes lovely pictures- I think it does the job very well.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this camera to anyone. I have no regrets in buying it- I love it!

Reviews.Title: Good battery life and that's about it.
Reviews.Author: KAT
Reviews.Content: Pros: good battery life, small size, colorCons: grainy pictures (regardless of setting, lighting, etc.) on screen, computer, and when printed out; video had lines through it; very slow shutter speed; complicated menusI was in the market for a small, simple point and shoot.  I found this camera on sale and purchased it without reading any reviews and boy that was a mistake. I didn't expect a camera that took professional quality pictures, but I definitely expected the pictures to look better than my old camera (a 4.0 megapixel Polaroid).  Literally I only took a handful of decent pictures in the year I owned this camera.  Lucky for me, my dog used the camera as a chew toy and I was able to replace it with a Polaroid t1234, which is cheaper, takes better pictures, has more megapixels, and overall is easier to use.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Plum Package
Reviews.Author: Marika
Reviews.Content: Ease of use, love the small compact style. Regardless of the other reviews, it takes wonderful photos. The other day someone blinked, it recognizes that! Wow, for the price and just to carry in your handbag! Love the quality of nikon. I would recommend for my friends.

Reviews.Title: A good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: art chick
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera even though the other customer reviews did not inspire a lot of confidence. So far I am happy with the camera, even though I have only downloaded one picture from the camera. The camera is super small and easy to transport in a purse. I am pretty happy with it and it is very easy to use. If you have enough money, then get a better camera. But if you don't, and I did  not have a lot of money, this camera will work just fine.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: J. Lang "Nutrition Junkie"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Christmas after my kids broke the Canon Powershot I've had for years.  While the camera is relatively easy to use, if you're familiar with digital cameras, I found the picture quality poor.  I gave the camera the benefit of the doubt after seeing blurry photos on the display screen.  Once I loaded the photos onto the computer for viewing I knew I had to return it.  Most of my Christmas holiday photos were useless due to the poor quality, grainy or just plain blurry.  The camera's "anti-shake" feature was on the entire time.  The face recognition option never finds the face in the photo. I know Nikon makes great cameras, but I wonder why this one is so crappy?I returned it today.Goin back to Canon most likely.

Reviews.Title: Consider this an "outdoor-only" camera
Reviews.Author: R. Wentz
Reviews.Content: This camera has a very hard time focusing in normal indoor lighting conditions.  I took many pictures with it over the holidays, and at least every other one is out of focus or grainy.  Even when it does manage to focus the image, it takes several tries.It takes pictures fine outdoors, or in very bright light.  But overall, it has only two advantages over my crappy iPhone camera - better resolution (mostly negated by how grainy most indoor photos are) and the 3x zoom, which is pretty much a standard feature on any $100+ camera these days, anyway.I would have returned mine, but I dropped it on a sidewalk soon after buying it (it took bad pictures before and after that incident).  That's one good thing about it though - the metal shell is pretty tough.

Reviews.Title: Don't do it,,,don't buy this camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ladylion7
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the worse point and shoot camera I have had owned!  Got it as a Christmas present this year and it is going back to the store!!! I currently have a Nikon digital SLR and I love it,,,was looking for a smaller point and shoot camera to use while chasing my Grandson around the house, since I have used Nikon cameras for many years I was not afraid to tell my family this is the camera I wanted,,,wrong~~~~The pictures are grainy,,strange colors apear on the faces of people in the pics,,,red eye is aweful,,only 5 of the 55 pics I took were good and those were taken almost standing on top of the shot. Very disapointed in this camera,,,don't waste your hard earned money!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect "10"
Reviews.Author: ChloKins
Reviews.Content: This little shoot & click camera is great.  The menus are extremely user-friendly. As for the cosmetic end - you can't beat the color selection! This little camera can fit in your pocket to be ready for use in an instant.  The lag time when snapping photos isn't bad, either - especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: Sad to say, not a good camera
Reviews.Author: Norm
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon Coolpix S220 for my daughter's birthday. She really loved the size and color. She learned to use it quickly and started taking pictures of her friends at her party. I noticed that some of the pictures were not clear and walked her through how to use the focus, etc a second time. She seem to be doing everything right. I took a few photo and got mixed results. I loaded these photos with iPhoto (iMac) and all the pictures that looked bad on the camera's LCD also looked bad on the computer; videos even worse. Here are the problems:1) Some photo are grainy; not just slightly, but really grainy. We were mostly taking photos indoors with flash.2) Every video we took was really grainy. My old Canon A510 takes better video and photos (3.2 megapixel).3) Some flash pictures have halos around subject4) Colors don't seem accurate; automatic white balance does not appear to work; manual setting seem to over correct; tungsten setting make photo's blue.I tried setting ISO to 80 (read some comments from other users). The camera did a little better with regards to the grainy photos, but the 80 ISO is not that great for indoor flash shots (400 would be better, but is too grainy).I am really baffled. Nikon is a good brand. I almost can't believe they would put their name on something that works so poorly. I expect the camera to at least take 'ok' pictures. Most of the pictures are, well, bad and it appears not at the fault of the user. I am not sure if there is something wrong (broken) with this camera, but I am going to return it. I am sad, my daughter is upset. Sad to say this, but stay away from this one.On the positive side, I did not find the camera to be slow at all (other reviewer comments), in fact, much faster than my old Canon. I also found operating the camera to be easy and I like features like the smile detection.

Reviews.Title: Pretty camera, crappy pictures
Reviews.Author: karend_mich
Reviews.Content: I returned this after taking a few test shots and comparing them to the ones from my ancient Canon.  The pictures from this Nikon were soft and blurry and just not good, even with file sizes four times the ones from the Canon of the same subject.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment!
Reviews.Author: T. Eto
Reviews.Content: I bought the Coolpix 220 because of the Nikon brand name.  I should have read the reviews first.  The picture quality is as bad as everyone says.  I took it on vacation and was totally disappointed with the pictures it took.  Colors were off and pictures were not sharp.  Unfortunately like other customers, I waited too long to return the camera so I'm stuck with something I won't use.

Reviews.Title: 10 MP fun!
Reviews.Author: Chetan Aneja
Reviews.Content: The camera looks great and is very easy to handle. The only problem is the display in the camera, the details are not visible, unless we zoom in. But actual picture quality is very good, for the price.

Reviews.Title: Nice Compact
Reviews.Author: Deborah Defilippo
Reviews.Content: Bought this as an early Christmas gift.  The request was for a camera that was compact and easy of use.  The recipient had a larger SLR camera but wanted something that could be carried all the time for those impromptu moments.  I selected this on the recommendation of a photography student.  The recipient seems to have be happy with choice.

Reviews.Title: Sleek
Reviews.Author: Nina
Reviews.Content: If your looking for an every day non professional camera this is the one for you! It takes pretty good pictures and is super easy to use. Definitely for first time camera owner. Being able to charge the camera is a plus :)... you never have to buy batteries again.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE Camera...Don't Waste Your Money
Reviews.Author: M. Burton
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this camera, and I wondered how bad could a camera really be?  The answer is TERRIBLE.  Yes, it is cute and little and easy to carry...but that really doesn't matter because it can't take a decent picture.I love Nikon and have owned several other Nikon cameras but this one is the worst by far.  It can't take a picture in any lighting situations.  The result is a grainy blurred mess.  Even switching it to a manual setting and changing the ISO won't make a difference.The videos are awful...there are lines throughout it and the colour is dreadful.Take my word, I didn't believe other reviews and should have.  You can get a far better camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Jones
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my friend. She carries it in her purse and provides me with quality snapshots of her trip. Ease of use is super

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S220  GIFT
Reviews.Author: ALAN TOMCO
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my daughter and she is very, very pleased with it.  She has had several cameras because they tend to "walk away" from her or get abused by "friends".  She says that the picture quality, especiall with faces, is the best she's ever had.  And this is the least expensive camera she has ever owned.  Her only complaint is that the range/power of the flash is not as good as she would like.

Reviews.Title: Nice Package, Crumby Optics
Reviews.Author: Russell Alexander "A Reviewer"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for the times when I don't have a lot of space and need a camera to slip into a shirt or jacket pocket. It fits my pockets very well. But so do a myriad of other cameras.This is my first Nikon product and probably will be my last. I purchased it because of the reputation of the Nikon brand. Unfortunately, this camera does not live up to that reputation. The images it produces are terrible.I returned the camera. Fortunately, I purchased the camera from Amazon so the return was almost effortless.

Reviews.Title: Terrible photos.  Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: C. Brown
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend for Christmas this year.  I purchased the Tuesday before Thanksgiving and decided to take it home for the holiday to test it out.  It is small and easy enough to use, but the photo quality is absolutely terrible.  I tested it in a variety of situations: inside, outside, bright light, low light, and even shot some video.  I would say it failed every category.  The photo quality is perhaps a step above a cellphone camera (but not by much) in my opinion.  I returned it on Black Friday and purchased a Canon SD 1200 IS.  It unfortunately cost me about $30 more, but I think it will end up being worth it.

Reviews.Title: terrible!  broke after 2 months!!  nikon refused to repair.
Reviews.Author: mz20
Reviews.Content: "I would not recommend this camera to any1. When I shut the camera off, it retracted off-track. I couldnt figure out why this occurred. I contacted Nikon, and sent the camera in for warranty repairs since I only had it for 2 months. nikon told me it wasnt covered undered warrant as the "front lens sustained an impact". It clearly did not!! they wanted $110 to repair it... I would not recommend this camera or any nikon to anyone.  Seems like this is a common issue w Nikon, that they refuse to warranty.  great job nikon.best buy reviews confirm that others are having this problem. terrible service & camera here from nikon.  i regret my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: R. M. Miller "rslickm"
Reviews.Content: What to say....this is the 3rd one I have purchased. 1 for daughter, 1 for wife, 1 for myself. Got a great price through Amazon on all 3 every time I ordered. If you get one, make sure you get a memory card and screen protector right away. Camera internal memory is next to nothing and the screen does scratch easily. I have 4gb cards in all 3.

Reviews.Title: Just the right size
Reviews.Author: G Leftwich
Reviews.Content: This little camera is just the right size to stick in my shirt pocket when I don't want to carry a bigger camera around. Camera was delivered on time and works fine takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Alert * Alert  Don't Buy It!
Reviews.Author: Linda Buchanan
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that took good, clear pictures and I know you don't have to spend a ton of money.  I read a couple of reviews on cameras and Canon seemed to be a good bet.  I went to Best Buy and was pretty much talked into this camera telling me it was just as good if not better than the more expensive Canon I was looking at. Well the pictures are so grainy and not in focus... after printing some of them out, I won't print the rest its a waste of my money. Since then I've found more reviews complaining about the same thing... don't buy, you'll be sorry. Buy the time I realized it wasn't me my 2 weeks to return it had pasted :(

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use
Reviews.Author: Kelly E. Woodruff "Kelly W"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It is my first digital camera and I am not good with electronic devices, but this one is very easy to use. I am taking pictures with confidence!

Reviews.Title: Nice style, inconsistent picture quality.
Reviews.Author: Juloboe "Julianne"
Reviews.Content: I love the color and style of this camera. I had no problem figuring out how to use it and how to change the settings. However, its auto mode for pictures is terrible. Most of the indoor pictures I took on auto were grainy. I was able to fix this by manually lowering the ISO, but the camera should be able to do this on its own. One picture I took I couldn't get the proper color quality---without the flash is was too yellow and with the flash it was white and washed out. I ended up using the picture with the flash and adjusting the color quality on my computer to get the photo to look alright.  The outdoor photos I took all turned out fine except for when I had manually lowered the ISO and forgot to change it back.I got this camera to replace my lost (stolen) Canon SD1200, and the Canon is much better. This Nikon can take as good of pictures as the Canon, but you're going to have to play around with the settings first.

Reviews.Title: seriously the worst camera i've ever seen.
Reviews.Author: radiowires "a lady"
Reviews.Content: I'm using this camera temporarily, my mom bought it a few months ago. Before I busted my 8 year old canon by dropping it, I assumed I was taking pictures as low-end as you can get, and that technology had really advanced when it comes to quality vs. cost.  Boy was I wrong! That ancient canon point and shoot takes photos 20x the quality of this camera. The pictures at best are grey-green and blurry. I've tried using all the various scene options and the highest resolution with no better results. Thank goodness I'm getting my own camera in the next 2 weeks. Please PLEASE spend the extra 30 bucks or whatever it takes to get a better camera. The photos from this are what I would expect on one of those little key-chain cameras you give to a 4 year old. I'm uploading one of the better indoor pictures i've taken, and keep in mind that is using a flash, 3 feet away from the subject.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!! GREAT PRICE!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Clark
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I bought one about a year ago and it was stolen. So I had to get it again! Its about the same size as the average cell phone. So it can easily be put in your pocket or in a small purse. Great images, easy to use. Theres a crop option when you review them. Couldnt be happier!!!

Reviews.Title: Why the bad reviews? This takes great photos!
Reviews.Author: Joseph M. Barney "Joe Barney"
Reviews.Content: I've read many bad reviews but this little camera takes great photos. Don't believe me? Check out my flickr, mostly taken with my Nikon S220, do a Find Camera on Flickr, find other Nikon S220 users and look at their photos. Also check out my Nikon S220 group on Flickr. It's: [...] - trust me this is a good camera for general photo taking but if you want an outdoor camera that won't short out when it rains, well, either buy protective coverings from Nikon (not sure if they have it for this model but going to check) or get a Panasonic or Olympus Tough waterproof/shock proof/dust proof one. I have to admit I really WISH that Nikon would come out with something like that. Here is my group: [...]

Reviews.Title: So much faster
Reviews.Author: A. Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Nikon L1 3 years ago and it died on me.  I love Nikon products.  I was in search for a smaller, faster camera.  I was amazed at how cheap these cameras have gotten.  This camera does not take a long time between pictures like my old one.  The difference in megapixiles is amazingly clear.  The size is so small now that I am worried about sitting on the camera when I put it in my pockets.  Love this camera.  Hope it lasts longer than the last but with technology rapidly changing, I'm probably going to upgrade again anyway.  Great price.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Bernard OBrien "logans daddy"
Reviews.Content: i received this camera this morning and i already hate it.  The shots all suck.  taking shots inside with a flash still gives me blurry pictures. The shots out side are ok at most. I only went with Nikon because my husbands use to be Nikon loyal but this was my first Nikon... I will be returning this and buying a canon or Sony.  Save you money and buy something a little better. In the past few years Ive had  Canon a Panasonic and a Sony and i will buy one of those  and will probably never buy Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Deal of a lifetime!
Reviews.Author: Susan Hult
Reviews.Content: This camera came with lots of accessories and works wonderfully.  I am totally happy with this purchase and feel I got a great deal!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: G. Howard "Shorty"
Reviews.Content: I use it all the time both for shotting videos and pics. It is great for small business or personal.

Reviews.Title: Point & shoots best small camera!
Reviews.Author: Bill Harper
Reviews.Content: compact - easy to carry  -  great pictures  -  much to like!  I have two - just alike - so the batteries and chargers work for both!

Reviews.Title: Nope
Reviews.Author: James Blinn
Reviews.Content: Got this as an X-mas gift.  I upgraded to the Canon T1I which was much more suitable for me.  Do not like!

Reviews.Title: Got what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Kristy HIntz
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what I wanted. Came as it was advertised and works perfectly. Fulfills all my needs. Is a gorgeous color.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S220 10mp Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom & 2.5 in screen
Reviews.Author: Crazy Horse
Reviews.Content: The price was right. The only reason I rated it 4 was because the battery & cord used for uploading the pictures were missing. I purchased this camera as a replacement because mine had a cracked screen. I don't know how old this camera was but I expect to get the same performance from this one.

Reviews.Title: Really great camera!
Reviews.Author: sixfives
Reviews.Content: Sent it to my son in FL and he loved it. Easy to use, easy to upload and store. Very good point & shoot type camera.

Reviews.Title: Nilon Coolpix digital camera
Reviews.Author: Jo Ann Van Horne "logcabbin"
Reviews.Content: Product arrived in a timely manner, just as described in ad, bought as a replacement for one stolen and is just like my original

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: rflirt
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice take along camera. It is small and fits in your pocket nicely. It takes good pictures and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Reynolds
Reviews.Content: takes nice pictures, and Nikon is a great brand.  It's a great "point and shoot" camera, and I like how when you take pictures of people, it puts a little box around their faces, so you can get it to focus clearly on the faces.  And afterwards, it sometimes asks you, "Was someone squinting?"

Reviews.Title: memory card
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A. McClure
Reviews.Content: The camera was a replacement for the exact one which was lost.  There was not a memory card with it.  I would have loved to know that up front so I could have bought one before receiving the camera. Should have been in the description.  However, it did not change my opinion of the seller.  It was timely sent and well packaged!

Reviews.Title: A camera thats easy to use
Reviews.Author: daniel robles
Reviews.Content: A great item and looking for of a camera with accessories for the unit. Still have it after all these years

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: LInda Greenhow
Reviews.Content: When I received this camera it worked but not well, fuzzy screen and eventually within a month It wouldn't open or close, wasted money on this

Reviews.Title: Good camera for a pocket point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Gail Peterson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera (in plum) a couple of years ago and have been overall very pleased with it.  The build and fit is very good.  Functions are easy to use and nicely laid out.  The large LCD on the back provides a good viewing area and the picture quality is acceptable, if you take the time to try to get the best picture in-camera and do not limit yourself to the built-in auto mode.  With some light post processing, the pictures are of a quality that will either accommodate a 5 x 7 print without undue image softness or distortions or posting on the web. In the 2 years I have owned this camera, I have not had a single mechanical problem with it.Does this camera take photos with the same image quality as my Nikon D7000?  Of course not, but for it's intended purpose, as a pocket-sized economical point-and-shoot DSLR camera, I really could not be happier and it still goes with me when I do not wish or cannot take my much larger Nikon along.  In fact, I often carry both, the CoolPix for the snap shots I wish to take and the D7000 for the photographs I'd plan to capture.

Reviews.Title: Perfect point & shoot
Reviews.Author: Joyannah E. Lonnes "JOY"
Reviews.Content: This little camera has a large screen on the back for easy viewing of your pics, charges while you download your pics to your hardrive and has intuitive features menu. I am enjoying mine a lot.

Reviews.Title: Horrible pictures! Not pleased!
Reviews.Author: caprice
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few years ago and I've regretted it ever since. I had a chunky kodak digital camera before this one, which used AAA batteries and broke, so I bought this camera to replace it. I liked the Nikon s220 because of all the great-sounding features it had, the slim style, and the color pink, my favorite color. BIG MISTAKE! This camera takes terrible pictures! Eventhough it has about 10 different picture settings, EVERY picture no matter what setting or where you are: outside, inside, light, darkness, flash, no flash, close up, far away, zoom in, zoom out, EVERY PICTURE LOOKS BLURRY AND HORRIBLE! I hate it! When i was doing the research about which camera to get at the time, a friend told me that i should get a cannon and i went against her for vanity reasons, and now here i am 3 years and hundreds of horrible pictures later, looking at nothing but cannon cameras! The only good thing about this camera is of course the color and the slim size. It fits in my clutch purses when i go out. that is it! still not worth it...

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Mikel ThreeZeroTwo
Reviews.Content: While I didn't buy this product off Amazon I just wanted give my thoughts about the S220.I got this Camera for my birthday a few years ago and while I was great at first I felt like the quality of my pictures was decreasing after the first 9 months. I am a light user and don't do alot of picture taking compared to some. I found the first pictures I took look great but as time went on more noise was starting to show. Then as of recent, I've had to replace this Camera because the pictures I took were getting blury around the edges of the object I was capturing.Pros: ~Features built in.  ~size (although it may be too small for some)  ~10MPCons: ~Battery Life.  ~Not built to last.  ~No new Firmware to update focusing problems.

Reviews.Title: Nikon camera
Reviews.Author: Sherry A. Scheller
Reviews.Content: I am not sure the camera is working properly. It could have been cleaned a little.It did arrive quickly though

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S220 Failed Twice In One Year
Reviews.Author: M. Cooper
Reviews.Content: Takes good pictures and easy to use, BUT, I returned it to Nikon last November with the lense error. They repaired it under warranty. This May it had a black spot on the viewfinder with what looks like something live crawling around in there. Returned to Nikon and diagnosed as "LCD Screen cracked/bleeding". Estimate to repair is $106. The original cost was around $130. Will replace with a new one, Not a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: A fantastic simple point and shoot
Reviews.Author: jodimcjodi "Jodi K."
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera maybe 2 years ago to have a point and shoot (I have a larger digital camera that takes great pictures but is not terribly portable).  It does what it is supposed to - takes solid photos in a variety of settings with little or no effort.Pros:It does what it is supposed to - takes solid photos in a variety of settings with little or no effort.Cute colors.Very trim and portable.Pretty durable.  Ours took an undisclosed number of trips to the floor at high speeds and still works fine.Battery life is very reasonable.Replacement or spare parts can be bought in non-name brands now, making them very affordable if you like to have an extra charger or battery around.Cons:The shutter speed is a bit lagging, so this is not the ideal camera to use in settings where a flash is needed but not allowed (some museums, special venues and historical sights) and it's performance on motion shots is mixed, but those are issues found across many point-and-shoots and is not unique to this Nikon Coolpix.There is a slight delay from when you press the button to take the shot and when the camera registers the shot.  Too much movement during that time can cause blurry photos.Recently, I bought a 2nd one of these cameras (a used one) for my 5 1/2 year old daughter so she would have a camera of her own for our trip to Paris.  She loved the plum color, and I loved that she could operate the camera on her own.  So long as the settings are all on auto, even a small child can point and press the button to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: good for price
Reviews.Author: C. Allen
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 2 1/2 years and am still happy with it.  It takes decent photos - about what you'd expect for a moderately priced point-and-shoot.  The flash washes everything out pretty badly, but I rarely use / need the flash (mostly I use it outdoors - if you do much indoor / low-light photography, this may not be a great camera).  I have carried it with me everywhere for 2 years, including 0*F ski trips, and it's still going strong.  The major drawback for me is that the battery doesn't last long at low temperatures (below 20*F or so).  While I'd love a high-end SLR, this is small and great for day-to-day use.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't last
Reviews.Author: Amicgood "Amicgood"
Reviews.Content: I have only owned this camera for about two years, and over the last 8 months, it has been slowly deteriorating.  The pictures are no longer clear, despite my trying every setting and every lighting condition I can think of.  At first, I began to notice that under a few settings (Sport, Museum, Party/Indoor, Dusk/Dawn) the pictures would turn out blurry, and maybe 20% of my pictures overall wouldn't turn out clearly.  Now, only one setting produces clear pictures and more than 80% of my pictures overall still turn out blurred, even when I set the camera down on a hard surface.  I wasn't expecting this camera to last forever, but I don't feel I got my money's worth.  I wouldn't recommend it unless you are only looking for a camera to work for a short period of time, or perhaps for a specific vacation/trip.

Reviews.Title: excelente
Reviews.Author: eze
Reviews.Content: excelent todo fue bueno el producto los tiempos de entrega la calidad todo no hubo problema con ninguna cosauna muy buena experriencia

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality!  Blurry 9 times out of 10!!!
Reviews.Author: Queens, NY
Reviews.Content: Woa, I thought I was going crazy or was just all thumbs taking photos because almost all of my photos with this camera are blurry...since Day 1 owning this camera in 2009 the photos have been blurry.I just assumed I was doing something wrong, since Nikon is an established name...oh but Nikon is the one doing something wrong here!I am fed up with the blurry photos!It has been heartbreaking; I got this camera in 2009 for a very important family wedding and was disappointed when so many photos were blurry and the lighting seemed so poor in the shots.  Everyone elses photos from different cameras of the same event were great...I have just returned from another family wedding in January 2012 and I am depressed; 79 of the 83 photos I took are blurry and lighting in photos is off.  DO NOT buy this camera.  SHAME ON YOU, NIKON!!!  I will NEVER buy another Nikon camera again.

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: Sage
Reviews.Content: the lcd display is clear and amazing. i had screen issues and had a great experience sending it back and having it replaced.

Reviews.Title: A halfway decent camera....while it lasted
Reviews.Author: T. Swett "Timmer90"
Reviews.Content: Despite the negative title, this really isn't that bad of a camera, it's just that one can buy much better than this. The color rendition is beyond strange, it has really poor response to variations in lighting (even by compact standards) and the auto focus can be unreliable. Excellent pictures can be coaxed out of this by careful post processing and careful shooting, but let's face it; most people aren't going to want to have to edit their photos, as it defeats to purpose of a "point and shoot". Other than that, it wasn't very durable, and the lens stopped opening correctly after a little over a year. I first though I'd gotten sand in the lens opening mechanism while hiking through the Grand Canyon, but upon taking apart the camera, I found no sand within the lens element. So simply some sort of manufacturing defect I'm assuming. Overall, seeing as others have had this problem as well, I'd advise spending a bit more and getting something else.P.S. here's an example of what the camera is capable of, when carefully composed and edited. [...]

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera Ever!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera 18 months ago, to have something reliable to take photos of our little ones. This was the wrong choice! The photos are grainy any time you use it indoors. The only time I could use it was for outdoor pictures, and even then it was iffy. This week the lens started not fully extending and we got the common "lens error" message. What a waste of money.I went and bought a Kodak Easy Share, for about half the price that the Nikon cost, and am so happy with it already. I have no clue why Nikon has their name on this piece of junk. I'm in the market for a DSLR, and I know that I won't be buying a Nikon now.

Reviews.Title: Complete Junk
Reviews.Author: j2k473
Reviews.Content: Out of the box it worked for about ten photos (which were real bad resolution for 10megapixel)it never left the inside of the house. First time trying to take a photo outside the lens goes in and out a few times then lens error message. Seems to be a big problem with this particular camera.  Wish I did more research before buying.  Canon guy from now on.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: AllieC
Reviews.Content: I actually already had the older version of this camera and I dropped it numerous times for about three years and it finally broke when my friend dropped it off his deck (yes I understand cameras aren't made to be dropped but it happened). So I bought the same camera and it works great. I totally suggest this camera to anyone who wants a good camera for a low price

Reviews.Title: Solid digital camera, no problems yet
Reviews.Author: Peace Daddy "Eclectic ReflectionZ"
Reviews.Content: We bought the Coolpix S220 in early 2010 when it was still relatively new to the market. After having owned it for a year now, I can say that it's definitely a solid camera at a decent price. The picture quality, in our experience, is vastly superior to our previous 7 MP camera. On 10 MP, we've only had a few pics turn out blurry, with the vast majority being crystal clear. The recording capabilities are on par with what we expected - you're not going to be able to record a hard rock concert with this, but for everyday use it gets the job done. The battery holds its charge fairly well, and after losing the original charger that came with the camera, we were able to find a cheap non-OEM charger that has worked well. The one thing that scares me with this camera is the amount of "Lens Error" complaints it has received.
