We've been taking good care of it, and (thankfully) haven't seen any errors of any sort in the year we've owned it. Hoping that it stays that way, as I'd like to get another couple years of use out of it.Overall, especially since the price has come down some, I give the Nikon Coolpix S220 a solid recommendation.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: bought this camera over a year ago....sorry for the delay on review ...but was a fantastic Xmas gift and an Awesome camera for the price.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: my iPhone takes better pictures
Reviews.Author: LankySudanese
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as gift last year, and I have never been more disappointed by the performance of a product from such an established company (Nikon in this case). The picture quality truly is HORRENDOUS. The pictures (at any ISO level) are so grainy, regardless of how much I played around with all the ostensibly-user-friendly features. I got into several embarrassing situations when I took pictures (at parties) with this camera, only for my friends to make a comment such as "what is wrong with your camera bro", and for one of them to take a better picture with their Canon or Kodak camera. And this from a Nikon! Sadly, I resolved to making my iPhone my default for taking photos. Running into the several (41) bad reviews of this camera on this site, AFTER my unsatisfactory personal experience was a sort of bitter-sweet moment. Bitter since I wish the friend (who bought this camera for me) had read these reviews beforehand. Sweet since now I can breath better knowing that it wasn't poor photography skills or low technical savvy that caused the poor pictures. This was further corroborated by the mediocre review that this product received at CNET reviews (which is the bench-mark for reviews, in my opinion). DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT, and DON'T ASSUME THAT ALL PRODUCTS FROM A WELL-ESTABLISHED COMPANY (such as Nikon in this case) WILL BE OF QUALITY.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever
Reviews.Author: DS86
Reviews.Content: This camera has been nothing but trouble.  The main problem is that it keeps giving a "lens error" which requires that the camera be sent in for repair.  The first lens error occurred within 6 months of purchase.  We sent it in for repair, and was covered by the one-year warranty.  About 9 months later, the lens error occurred again.  I called Nikon, and they refused to guarantee that it would be covered, since we had the camera for over a year and the last repair was over 6 months ago.  This came with a 12-month warranty, and I've never been able to use the camera for 12 consecutive months.  When it works, the camera is fine - good pictures, nice features, etc.  The problem is reliability. If you want a camera you can count on, look for something else.

Reviews.Title: Learn to use the settings and you'll get very nice photos
Reviews.Author: Audiophan
Reviews.Content: I use this camera on my job and it takes great photos, and in a variety of lighting/scene situations. It is not, however, the best in low light situations without using the flash.You can read the manual, but I find the best way to learn to use any camera like this is to play with all the settings.Are your images grainy? Press the "Menu" button and select "Scene," then image mode, then select a higher quality image mode. I use normal, but you could bump it up to High if you wish. The higher the quality image the larger the photo file size, meaning you'll have less space on the SD card for a lot of photos.Do you find that the LCD screen is too dark or too bright? You can adjust it. Press Menu again and select the tool that looks like a wrench. You'll find all sorts of controls that you can adjust to your preferences. And of course this is where you'll find the "format" card command... Every time you delete your photos from the camera's memory it's wise to format the card.Now for the "Scene" command button, which is just to the upper left of the four-way command control. You can leave it on Auto, or... use the four-way command control to select "Scene." Then cycle through the many choices, including portrait, sports (fast action shots) landscape, beach, snow, museum, Subway, Pizza Hut, etc..:)If you and your subject are standing in the shade, and sunlight is behind your subject, you may want to experiment with "Forced Flash" mode. This will cause the camera flash to turn on no matter what and will properly illuminate your subject's face so it doesn't end up looking dark with a bright background. Press the four-way command button, the up button with the image of a lighting bolt. Cycle down to the lighting bolt and you'll be in forced flash mode. Check out the other flash modes while your there.Wanna make a video? the "Scene" button and cycle down to "Movie" and your camera becomes a video camera...  (You can also use the camera as a voice recorder!).Have you been disappointed about the quality of indoor photos of friends/family etc. because the flash illuminated their faces way way way too much? Here's a photo trick I often use indoors: Step back three or four or five or six feet from where you had planned to take the photo. Then zoom in just to the point where you would have been standing, and then take the photo! You'll get a more evenly balanced facial tone and even capture more of the background that would tend to have be washed out when standing too close to your subjects. (You can also try the "party" mode - using the Scene button to access all of the special selections)If you'd like to take really really close-up photos, of say Abe Lincoln's face on a penny.. Select "Macro" mode. There are two ways to activate it. One is by pressing the Scene button then cycling down to "scene" then cycle to the right and select the icon of the two tulips...Or, you can leave the setting on "auto" and using the down command button, which shows the image of those tulips again, press and select "on" for macro close-up mode.As with all cameras of their ilk, when you don't have a viewfinder to look through on a sunny day, you have to rely on the LCD screen, which can be impossible to see in bright light.That's about it... other than it uses a special Mini B to USB cable. I got one on Amazon for a couple of bucks.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy!!!
Reviews.Author: T. Ogaard
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Target 3 months ago. 4 days ago I went to take a picture and the screen was white. I contacted customer service and they told me to take the battery out and let it set over night claiming that would fix it. No dice! I hooked it up to my computer to upload my pictures, and I got an error message saying there was an error with the device. As I plugged it in, the lens went to retract and jammed. I reported that to Nikon and they said they would not repair any device that has any physical damage, even though it was obviously a manufacturing defect. So now I am out $150 a mere 3 months after I bought it.Do Not Buy This Product! Unless of course, you like to waste money.

Reviews.Title: 3rd LCD screen in less than one year!
Reviews.Author: n
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on an impulse before a trip last summer.  4 Days into the trip I turned on the camera to find the LCD screen had been broken.  Neither my girlfriend or I could think of any likely scenario that would have caused such damage.  After returning home and doing some research, it really upset me to find dozens of reviews online that echoed my same gripe about a fragile LCD screen.Instead of going the route of trying to return/repair the screen through Nikon (which I discovered through online reviews/forums was almost as pricey as a new camera) I found another LCD screen online that was specifically designed for an s220.  Then that one broke after about 9 months.  I just today installed the 3rd LCD screen.Do not buy this camera for this reason alone.  But other reasons also apply: picture quality is definitely sub par to other 10 megapixel cameras I have used.  The pictures are very grainy and/or blurry on most settings.

Reviews.Title: Fragile - Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: Vinson Johnson
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and needed a small durable camera to document construction sites. With batteries and cards it was a nearly $200 investment. It worked great for two working days until I sat down with the camera in the front pocket of my suit pant. This is a loose suit. The pressure from the summer weight wool pant cracked the lcd view screen. I heard the pop. Nikon service offered me the discounted repair for $100. I declined repair.Stay Away. Too Delicate For Any Type of Use.It is cheap, not inexpensive. Nikon designed it that way.I expected a better product and better support from Nikon.Never again.

Reviews.Title: Cute, Portable, and Easy to Use!!
Reviews.Author: Seaturtle
Reviews.Content: What a joy to find a camera that is so small that it fits in your pocket or pocketbook but takes great pictures!  It is so easy to connect to charge the battery by simply plugging in a power cord. Comes with a USB connector cord for downloading pictures making it a breeze!  I love how easy it is to program this camera - simple instructions and easy to understand icons to remind you of what to do.I will never go big and bulky again!!!!

Reviews.Title: loving it
Reviews.Author: big al
Reviews.Content: i fall in love with this camera it work perectfullyi want to buy another one for back up

Reviews.Title: Good product bad service.
Reviews.Author: Shannon1
Reviews.Content: I did not receive a battery with this camera, which I'm sure is supposed to be included because all other accessories were sent with camera and the camera cannot be operated without a battery. I contacted the company as soon as I received the camera and they never returned my e-mails.

Reviews.Title: Initial Happiness followed by disappointment
Reviews.Author: M. Kei "~K~"
Reviews.Content: I am brand new to photography, so I wanted an inexpensive, simple, point and shoot camera that gives good quality pictures. I thought I'd found it with the Nikon Coolpix -- my daughter took our first one to Australia and loved it, so I bought one for myself. I am very happy with the picture quality. I found the controls less than intuitive, though, and I don't know how to do all that I want to do with the camera or all that it's capable of doing. I suppose a more experienced photographer would suss it out without thinking, but then, an experienced photographer is probably not buying a starter camera like this.I am profoundly disappointed that after a mere four months the screen's gone blank. It still takes pictures -- but nothing shows in the screen. I can't see what I'm framing, I can't see the shot after I've taken it, I can't review the shots. The screen is either blank white or sometimes a flickering grayscale. A search of the web has not turned up any information about dead screens that I can find. I really think the lifespan of an inexpensive camera ought to be more than four months.There is no visible damage to the screen, so no obvious explanation for why the screen doesn't work. The camera has never gotten wet -- and I checked to make certain it was water-resistant before buying it. The worst thing that's ever happened to it was being used to shoot pictures in fog and high humidity (a frequent occurrence while at sea, or ashore).~K~

Reviews.Title: Grainy and Noisy Indoor Pictures...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Lurker
Reviews.Content: I am taking into account that this is just a "point and shoot" camera but even so I expect that the majority of my pictures will not come out grainy! In comparison with some of my other friends cameras such as the "Canon Powershot" the Nikon 220 just does not measure up. I have tried to adjust the camera settings, but nothing seems to work in reducing the amount of noise in the pictures.It is especially prevalent in indoor settings or ones with low lighting. If you have some good natural lighting and you are taking pictures with this camera the woes of its poor quality are not as noticeable.Anyway if you don't care too much about the quality of your pictures, and you want a "cute" and portable camera... you can save a few bucks and go with this one. I got mine from Costco awhile ago when it was on sale so it came with a case and some other stuff. I regret not wanting to spend a few extra dollars in order to get a better quality camera.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: makin820
Reviews.Content: Love camera size and portability.  Easy to use.Picture quality is good, but good be better.Overall, good camera.

Reviews.Title: Little Nikon digital camera
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Richardson
Reviews.Content: About the smallest of the popular no frills, easy to use point and shoot digital camera.  Nikon quality throughout.  You might like a larger zoom, or a bigger LCD, but for around $100, you cannot complain.

Reviews.Title: Utterly disappointed!!!
Reviews.Author: R. VAN DAELE
Reviews.Content: I didn't buy this camera (Nikon S220) from amazon, I bought it from target. That doesn't change the FACT that this camera is a horrible camera! I returned it!Yes, it is portable but that is possibly the only thing that would be considered okay with the camera. It takes extremely GRAINY pictures! The auto did more harm than good, and when I would try to set the mode it didn't help either. It took the camera pretty long to focus also. When lighting in a room or outside was even a little bit dark(or only one light was on in the whole room)the picture would come out yellow. Sunsets/nature pictures are out of the question with this cameraThe main thing that really got me was how GRAINY the photos were! I have never seen such down right BAD picture quality all around! I had wanted a Nikon camera for along time, not anymore.I wouldn't recommend this camera for anyone!!I now own a Cannon PowerShot SD780 IS, BEST camera I've seen! Takes AMAZING pictures, portable, easy to use, CHECK IT OUT!

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix
Reviews.Author: Rebecca S. Garnault "becky.g"
Reviews.Content: It is a really nifty little camera and the picture quality is excellent, there are also various adjustments that allow creativity in shots. I love the colour!

Reviews.Title: How do I return this???
Reviews.Author: Lilian Quispe Yana "LilianQY"
Reviews.Content: I had a Nikon before a coolpix 5600, GREAT camera!!!! the pictures were great, I barely had to fix them. I waited for this camera so long!!! Because unfortunately mine was stolen, and I was happy because I thought this might be even better. This camera is awfull, all the pictures are grainy no matter how good the light is if not then they're blurry!!!! I wish I had never bought it :( This is the worst shop ever!! And now that I'm trying to get my old one costs $399!!!!! I will continue looking for that one.

Reviews.Title: Only one small complaint
Reviews.Author: J. Morrison
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I have is the charging method.  You must remove the battery to charge it.  So, instead of a simple charging cord, you need a cord and a battery "docking station" (it is included with the camera).  This is a little more bulky for travel than just a simple cord.

Reviews.Title: Biggest Piece of Junk Ever......
Reviews.Author: J. Neal
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera i have ever bought! I felt like i was taking care of a new born baby! It breaks with the slightest TOUCH of the screen. Even with a carrying case this piece of junk breaks somehow in the case. Im going to invest in a canon or something not made to sit on a desk. I would not recommend this camera to anyone who actually gets out of the house. I went through 3 after the third return i just got a Cannon. Seriously dont buy this save your self SO much stress and trouble. Go for another company!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Coolpix not the best Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Kathryn A. Burchfield "Kathryn Burchfield"
Reviews.Content: My husband did a lot of research on cameras before he purchased this one for me for my recent birthday. On a daily basis he uses a Kodak Easyshare at his work but all the reviews said that this Nikon Coolpix would be a better choice for us to have at home. When we received the camera we were very pleased with the size (it's super small) and the clean look of it (not too many buttons).But as soon as we took a picture with it we knew that we weren't going to be happy. The pictures were grainy, the color was distorted and the quality was just not as good as the Kodak Easyshare. We actually took the same pictures with each camera side by side and the Kodak pictures were much better!We tried adjusting all of the settings, lighting, flash, aspect ratio, etc., and nothing worked.Also, the Nikon has a lot less buttons than the Kodak, but I soon realized that those extra buttons save me a lot of searching through menus to find a setting.Since the cameras were virtually the same price, we sent the Nikon Coolpix back and are now ordering the Kodak Easyshare.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Indoor Photos
Reviews.Author: Summer L. Limbo "OmahaMomx3"
Reviews.Content: I have had many digital cameras in the past 10 years and I have to say this is the worst camera I've ever had.  It takes awful indoor photos.  The flash is not strong enough and every single indoor photo is blurry and/or yellow in color.  I've called Nikon and made sure all my setting were the factory defaults and I've tried using all the different flash options but nothing really seems to help.  VERY disappointed in this camera.

Reviews.Title: okay for its price--compared to canon powershot
Reviews.Author: Rachel "college student"
Reviews.Content: After having a sony cyber shot for a few years and being very happy with it, it stopped working well and I found myself in the market for a new camera. I wanted to try a different company, and I basically narrowed it down to Canon, which a lot of my friends have, and Nikon. With Canon my choice was the canon powershot sd1200 and the nikon coolpix. I knew my friends were happy with the Canon, and it's a very popular camera in general, but when reading reviews I didn't see much difference between the Canon and the Nikon. And so I decided to go with Nikon since it was cheaper and I really liked the colors (yes, I actually picked a camera based on color). I think the coolpix is an okay camera, especially considering how cheap it is. However, if you really want a camera that consistently takes good photos I would go with the canon. Maybe I just don't have the setting right, (the settings are very confusing, and they have really obscure ones like "museum" and "food") but sometimes my pictures come out really blurry or with weird yellow light. But other than that it is a pretty decent camera. And I do love the color.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S220 for Megan
Reviews.Author: Big Mama "Kathy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter.  She had another Nikon Coolpix S210 and lost it at Disneyland.  I wanted to replace it since she uses it all of the time.  She says that it is better than the other model and takes great pictures and is very easy to use.  Based on her input, I would highly recommend this camera to anyone who loves to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: great small camera for kids and people with kids
Reviews.Author: ReaderMomTeacher
Reviews.Content: We bought one of these for our 10 year old for Christmas.  She was immediately able to take very good pictures with it.  She also quickly figured out how to use the other features, and enjoys the video capability.  The battery holds a charge for a long time, even when using the flash.  Video quality is decent, even in indoor lighting.  It's not a professional quality camera, but has great quality for the low price and small size.  I think I'd like one of these for myself.  It's tiny, but takes much better photos than other small cameras we've had (or the camera on my phone).  We just ordered one for our 9 year old's birthday.  She had a Kodak (can't remember the model#), which was horrible.  Half the time it wouldn't even power up properly.

Reviews.Title: Just as expected
Reviews.Author: Claire Boldrick
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived timely & in perfect shape.  It was for my daughter & she is very pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Horrible picture quality
Reviews.Author: Donald H. Yip
Reviews.Content: This camera is great looking and a good portable size - "cute" would be the word to describe it. But when you see the images from the camera, you will be appalled, especially given the price of the camera. I got mine nice and cheap, but looking at the prices at various stores (saw it for $200 in one) there is no way the price is justified. I compared the photos from my s220 with my Nokia 6500 Slide 3.3MP phone, and I kid you not, the quality of the photos is the same. I love Nikon SLR cameras (I have a d700), but they really need to improve the quality of their compacts. I am never buying a Nikon compact again.

Reviews.Title: NIkon Coolpix -Great Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Sigel
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price, loads of features and settings. Takes great pictures. I love the battery charger- it lasts so long so you don't miss any photo opportunities

Reviews.Title: John's Review
Reviews.Author: John W. Borchers
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera, small and compact, but still takes good quality photos. Originally bought this camera as a gift for my wife, but it has become the family camera as it is a lot easier to carry and use than my digital SLR.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Joseph R. Freitas
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my 12 yrs old Grand daughter and she loves it. Easy to use and compact easy to carry..........

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Lisa A. Evoy "LAE"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my niece who is 19 yrs. old.  She took it on a recent trip and the photos came out better than I would have expected.  The color was vibrant and the prints came out great.  She loved how easy it was to use and that it fit into a pocket or purse with ease.

Reviews.Title: Not good.
Reviews.Author: Steph
Reviews.Content: I was simply looking for a "put it in my purse" camera when I bought this.  I own an SLR, and I certainly didn't expect this camera to come across with that type of quality.  I did expect Nikon to come up with something better than this though!  I adjusted ISO, adjusted megapix's, played around with it.  I am willing to bet that it takes some decent full light pictures.  I was shooting in the evening, just basic kids playing around the house types of shots.  They were awful.  The viewfinder first will show you a very yellow/orange picture and then when you shoot it, well, it's a crapshoot what you're going to get!  The pictures were more often than not very fuzzy.The size and weight were just what I was looking for.  Deck of cards.  I bought the plum color and that was really cute.IMO, not Nikon quality at all.  I returned it and got a Kodak.  Superior pictures...surprised me.

Reviews.Title: Great easy-to-use camera!
Reviews.Author: B. Sessions
Reviews.Content: My daughter got this camera for her 9th birthday.  She's been begging for a camera for quite some time, as she has definitely outgrown her KidTough camera.  The color is beautiful, and the camera is very simple to use.  She and her friends had a blast taking pictures of one another at her party.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Cookpix
Reviews.Author: Debra L. Karplus, occupational therapist
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is exactly what I was looking for.  I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Christmas Present for My Granddaughter
Reviews.Author: Carol Ree "CRee"
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter loved the camera and so did I. She liked that it was blue - her favorite color. I like that I found at Amazon.com at a great price.

Reviews.Title: No Mass Storage Support = No-Go
Reviews.Author: SleepyKat
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and is a small and compact shooter. Pictures however were marginal. There seemed to be a fishey effect on images, where they are clear at the center, but blurred on the edges.  Also it did poorly with colors unless the lighting was bright.  A major drawback for me is the lack of support for mass storage class drivers (eg plug into computer and see it as a storage device/ hard drive). Nikon should provide this functionality in the camera. For me this is a no-go. I do not want to have to use special apps & drivers to get to my photos (Win2k/XP), nor do I want to use a card reader. On Vista the camera connected and worked pretty well.

Reviews.Title: No Mass Storage Support = No-Go
Reviews.Author: SleepyKat
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and is a small and compact shooter. Pictures however were marginal. There seemed to be a fishey effect on images, where they are clear at the center, but blurred on the edges.  Also it did poorly with colors unless the lighting was bright.  A major drawback for me is the lack of support for mass storage class drivers (eg plug into computer and see it as a storage device/ hard drive). Nikon should provide this functionality in the camera. For me this is a no-go. I do not want to have to use special apps & drivers to get to my photos (Win2k/XP), nor do I want to use a card reader. On Vista the camera connected and worked pretty well.

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera
Reviews.Author: C. Walker "Dozrman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly for it's compactness.And it fill that bill very well,plus it has lot of features that are real nice.The only down side is picture quality is a little off.But I have other cameras for that.It's great for spontanious picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix... Cool.
Reviews.Author: Coreydude
Reviews.Content: It's a good camera, I like the closeup feature, but I wish it was HD video. other than the video, its a great overall camera for any skill level.

Reviews.Title: Poor pictures and video
Reviews.Author: alb304
Reviews.Content: You can find better cameras than this camera for the price. If you don't care at all about the picture and video quality. Just like the portability and design and doesn't care for value. This is the camera for you! For everyone else you can find a much better camera.ProsEasy to useit takes picturesslim nice designconshorrible image quality!horrible video quality!I didn't have time to test the battery life though. Since right when I turned it on I didn't like it. I gave it chance by changing the settings but nothing worked. I used it for an hour then returned it. I'm now looking for another camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor photo quality
Reviews.Author: B. Hooper
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these camera's, one for my 15 year old and one for my 11 year old.  I selected Nikon becasue I have a D80 and love it, and also because the camera was "Blue and Green".  After Christmas was over the family was reviewing the photo's taken and they were horrible.  Out of focus and grainy. I do not believe it was user error because I took several photo's myself and changed the settings to see if they would improve and it did not.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Purchase
Reviews.Author: Edward Stein
Reviews.Content: Priced better than all the other places I checked on. With free shipping it was a heckuva deal... good product.. easy to use, good quality

Reviews.Title: Great on the go camera.....
Reviews.Author: trolldoll-1 "book, music lover"
Reviews.Content: I own a Nikon D50 SLR camera - not easy to lug around. I have been interested in a point and shoot that would be easy to carry aroung, quick to pull out, and easy to take pics. I use a 1G memory card in my SLR and that gives me about 400 pics -- this Coolpix S220 has a 2G memory card, zoom, bigger view screen than my Nikon D50 SLR, and all around easy to use.  My SLR has a wide angle lens but the zoom ability with this Coolpix helps it to take great pics. So far I am not disappointed -- I got it as a present from my Company's Christmas Party so I have not had it very long but I am having fun experiencing using this cute camera!

Reviews.Title: Big mistake
Reviews.Author: J. Wright "savebernards"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a new camera to replace my Easy Share 6.1 MP camera, and thought I couldnt go wrong with Nikon. I wanted a new camera with at least 10 MP, and lots of features for our annual fund raiser event of pet pictures with Santa. I wanted to make sure the pictures were really clear, like the ones my friend took with her Canon last year.  I now know that if I wanted pictures that looked the the ones taken with a Canon, that is what I should have bought.The pictures yesterday were totally unuseable.  They came out too dark, too yellow, or too light and yellow, without any adjustment, only using auto mode.  I am going back to my Easy Share with 6.1 MP today, because at least the colors are true.I wish I had read all of these negetive reviews before my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good All Around
Reviews.Author: William K. Aiktne
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I bought this model.  I use it for my business photos and family photos.  It does everything right for on the out of the pocket quick shots.  Love it.  However, it does not do well when dropped on rocks.

Reviews.Title: Very noisy pictures
Reviews.Author: Huong T. Dinh "Bremily"
Reviews.Content: I was so happy when I first get this camera until I start to shooting more photos, the LCD is low light and picture inside the house is bad quality.  Picture outdoor is great but the macro is very bad compare to CanonI got canon SD660 and got error len and cost $100 to fix but picture quality is best with good macro.  Nikon is very portable small size nice color but very bad quality photos.This camera is only good for kid to use not for family photos.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I ever owned!!
Reviews.Author: Nancy McElroy "THE MOM"
Reviews.Content: This camera is GREAT! I was looking for something simple, but that still took great pictures.  This camera is for you if that is what you are looking for! And the price was AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: Broke!!!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M. Dowell
Reviews.Content: The lens broke in the 1st 3 months and I'm struggling to get it fixed. They made it sound like a common problem!! find another one!!

Reviews.Title: MS
Reviews.Author: M. Smirnova "Mary"
Reviews.Content: I wanted something small and cheap with decent picture quality. S220 was the smalest and cheapest camera I could find in local store. Really like how small it is and it still feels comfortable in hand. I can easy fit it into my pocket and take everywhere. Picture quality is not the best espesially with low light. But the price it unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: Good Camaera
Reviews.Author: James Love "James Love"
Reviews.Content: The camara performs as advertised. I have taken several pictures since my purchase and all have turned out great. I am also very pleased with Amazon.com. Each time iv purchased with Amazon, I have not been disappointed with my order nor with the excellent service. JLove

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: toasty topper "Catherine"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 13 year old daughter. She LOVES it. She had no trouble figuring out how to use it and is very happy with the pictures. It's a good value with lots of features. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Gary E. Hays "BigPoppaG"
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed with the photo quality. Granted the camera was bought for it's color (My Wife's Camera) but the quality and ease of use make it a great find. I would recommend. It has a little weight to is to it doesn't feel or look like some of those cheap cameras.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Mccormick
Reviews.Content: This camera is definitely worth the money, but the zoom could be ALOT better.It takes clear pictures unless your zooming in on something.

Reviews.Title: Not so Cool CoolPix
Reviews.Author: St. Charles
Reviews.Content: I am very familiar with cameras and I was disappointed with this Nikon picture quality for a 10.0. Pics look fine in their orginal format but when I used editing software the grains came out.I talked with another experienced shooter of the Nikon and he had the same problem and returned the camera.It has nice features, small and easy to use but none of that matters if the end result...the picture is no good.Research and buy another camera, not the Nikon S220

Reviews.Title: very clear camera
Reviews.Author: Rhonda
Reviews.Content: this Nikon s220 is the greatest little camera I have owned, it takes beautiful zoom photos very clear.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Cool Pix IS cool!
Reviews.Author: E. Goodwin
Reviews.Content: daughter was very happy with the very cool colors available on this model.  Do wish the zoom was a bit better-not very strong...but it seems to work OK.  Downloads seem easy...she's having fun!

Reviews.Title: fragile
Reviews.Author: Ralph M. Plummer "ivory doc"
Reviews.Content: The few pictures taken were great however, the internal screen cracked and now the camera will not work.  It's only 2 weeks out of the box.  UPS picked it up today for repair so we will see how well Nikon backs their products.Nikon responded by charging me over $100 to fix the camera.  This is most likely the last Nikon camera I will every buy.

Reviews.Title: Worse quality than a cell phone camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Dan Man"
Reviews.Content: Seriously?  This thing is SO bad, you'd think I bought it from a counterfeit street vendor in Times Square.  I have a Canon Powershot from 7 or 8 years ago that takes better photos than this thing. Indoor photos - even in bright natural light (we have a cathedral ceiling with a wall of windows that faces south), photos look like they're stills from a video camera or something.  I've checked the settings, and it's set to the highest resolution.  Below are a handful of pics I took with this camera, two indoor, two outdoor.  You can't really tell in the outdoor shots since Photobucket shrinks the images, but even in bright outdoor light, with the camera held 100% steady, the details are all fuzzy (you can really tell in the original, full size, 4.2Mb versions of the yard pics).  I've taken pics in shady situations with my old deck-of-cards-size Canon Powershot back in 2003 that were good enough to frame at 5x7.  These are hardly good enough to be cellphone wallpaper.  That's what I get for buying a cheap camera at Costco.  This one is going in a drawer and never coming out - I'd sooner use my Droid for indoor photos.  I find it hard to believe I can't find a different compact camera for my wife for a little more money that will actually take photos worth keeping as long-term memories (I mean, what else is a camera FOR?)[...]

Reviews.Title: Love my new Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Maxwell
Reviews.Content: Quick delivery, great camera for the price.  I was trying to decide between this Coolpix and the one with more zoom - and more expensive price.  I went ahead and got this one and so far have been very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great little Point and Shoot camera with zoom
Reviews.Author: RedMolly "Artist: Painter and Clay Sculpture"
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S550 10MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom (Plum)EXCELLENT CAMERA: We own 3 professional cameras, but needed a lightweight, portable, quality camera to simply carry everywhere (for example beach means sand and who wants to go to the beach or for a ride on a motorcycle, or walk along a long boardwalk burdened with heavy bags of camera equipment?). Surprisingly the quality of the Nikon Coolpix S550 is "almost" on par with our other professional cameras for general photo taking. Perfect for quick newspaper shots, quick travel shots and 10MP studio shots. The zoom is only 3x but fine for general closeups. Nikon point and shoot zoom on two cameras I've owned is not their best feature. It is also a bit shaky, so I carry it on a lightweight, collapsible monopod. (National Geographic NGTM1 Tundra Monopod with Head and Quick Release Plate 785PL). If you experiment with the settings and scenes you can "mimic" manual in some cases. The smile detection is a bit annoying at times, but...it is a point and shoot camera. A fun, high quality, multifunctional, lightweight, hard working little camera. Buying another one for hubby for our next journey.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: B. Hooper
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these camera's, one for my 15 year old and one for my 11 year old.  I selected Nikon becasue I have a D80 and love it, and also because the camera was "Blue and Green".  After Christmas was over the family was reviewing the photo's taken and they were horrible.  Out of focus and grainy. I do not believe it was user error because I took several photo's myself and changed the settings to see if they would improve and it did not.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S220 avoid at all costs
Reviews.Author: A. Olivera
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera over the summer thinking it was going to take some nice pictures while visting Italy.  Overall,  I was extremely disappointed with the picture quality especially when taking pictures inside the museums and night shots. Inside the museum, the pictures came out grainy and I noticed the camera couldn't take decent pictures at night.  Night pictures looked blurry and out of focus. I orginally paid 149.99 for this camera and then resold it taking a loss of 69 dollars. Avoid this camera at all costs.  I'll stick to Cannon or Sony for my next camera purchase.  I'll think twice about purchasing a Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix review
Reviews.Author: Judy A. Jacquinot
Reviews.Content: I love it.  I've had a Nikon Coolpix before and I love this one even more.  The pictures are crisp.  Menu's are easy to follow, and the available colors are an added bonus.  I would definitely recommend this product to a friend!!

Reviews.Title: LCD Screen Cracks!  Don't buy this camera
Reviews.Author: A. Edson
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Cool Pix S220 about six months ago and was very happy with it until recently I turned it on and the LCD was cracked from the inside.  Nikon refused to repair it under warranty and demanded that I pay $107 for them to fix it.  I am very careful with cameras and kept this one in a padded case.  The LCD is very cheap and Nikon will not cover it under warranty.  Avoid this camera.  I cannot speak for other Nikon cameras, but since they are not standing by their product, I will not buy another one.The screen was white with several crack lines across it.  Tech people said it was caused from the inside.  Shouldn't they fix it since it is Nikon parts?

Reviews.Title: Fast shiping good camera retarded button
Reviews.Author: Savannah Schultz "Sav"
Reviews.Content: It's a pretty good camera for the price but the button you press to take the picture is built right on top of the zoom button. It is soo annoying because half the time I go to take a picture it accedently zooms in. Sucks but other than that it's a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: my say
Reviews.Author: S. Mclean "KoolKidReview"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes really bad pictures... I would not tell anyone to buy this  this dumb camera  not even a 7 year old can appreciate this. I think this camera should be taken off the market. I would recommed the kodak m380 over this camera anytime.Really , I hate this camera all it does is make your picture looks bad .. yup it's that bad.the only good thing about this is the colour (plum) the size the weight and that's about it.If you want u can waste your money and buy one. Notice I said waste becuz u will throw it a way and buy a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Ok for the price
Reviews.Author: V. Faller
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix is a good camera but I feel the pictures aren't as good as other camera's. A couple of years ago I bought a Kodak camera for around $90 and I feel the pictures were superior to this camera.

Reviews.Title: COOLPIX S220
Reviews.Author: Vikinglover
Reviews.Content: I purchased this in "good" condition and when I got it .. the camera screen was cracked! It wouldnt even turn on! So needless to say it was a waste of money.. I just will buy thing like electronics new.  They should have noted that the screen was crakced and that the on off switch was hard to switch over.

Reviews.Title: It's a POINT & SHOOT people...
Reviews.Author: Melissa A. Marowelli "CPS Tech & Mom of 5"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for professional quality pictures this is not the camera for you. If you are looking for a "keep in your purse, easy to use, small & portable" type camera that is relatively inexpensive then this could be one for you.How frustrating to have to weed through all these negative reviews by people who haven't read their manual and set up the proper settings on their camera! Yes it's a point & shoot camera, but it has many of the settings available on the more expensive cameras, so you actually have to set it up to achieve the results you are looking for.I generally use a Canon Rebel for my "important" pictures & events, but there are times when I don't want to lug the "big" camera with me, or we stop at the park on a spur of the moment whim and I don't have it with me, so I wanted a small point & shoot that I could keep in my purse.I had a Fuji z1 but wanted to upgrade and pass the Fuji down to my 9yo son.I bought this camera for under $100 on sale at Nebraska Furniture Mart...it has done the job as intended and with the proper settings it produces decent point & shoot pictures. Are they on par with my Rebel? No, of course not! Are they on par with my Fuji, yes, and even better for some shots.I have had my camera for 6 months now and am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Ha
Reviews.Author: emolique "emolique"
Reviews.Content: This was suppossed to be a replacement camera. Thought it'd be ok to buy it used. Boy did I fool myself! I bought it from a seller that swore it was like new and when I got it the LCD screen was snowy and then he had a nerve to tell me that he had a perfect rating before I left him negative feedback which a later found out it is against amazons policy for sellers to hound buyers about negative feedback! The only reason I kept this camera is because even though the pics came out snowy on the LCD screen they came out clear on the computer... go figure... anyway, Buy it new and try to purchase from Amazon not from a seller if it's used. Makes for easier returns just incase anything is wrong. Amazon is great to deal with if it's their product. No hassles with them just watch out for some of these sellers... I'm currently dealing with a "seller" now trying to get a refund on a $344 vita-mix blender I purchased that was defective... OMG here we go again! LMFBO!!!:)

Reviews.Title: Great Disappointment!!
Reviews.Author: Martha H. Slayton "Martha Slayton"
Reviews.Content: The camera screen cracked within 1 day of use!!!!  How do I go about returning it for replacement???Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Worst picture quality I've seen in acamera
Reviews.Author: L. M.H.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera the first of December for my wife as a gift to take on a girls trip to Cancuan. When she returned with her pics we were so disappointed with the picture quality that we didn't keep one picture from her trip. I took a chance and bought it against my better judgement after reading the reviews on it, which told of it's poor picture quality. Well, the reviews were all true. Save youself time and trouble and bypass this camera. I've already packed it up and sent it back, luckily the only thing I'm out is the shipping.To give you an idea of what pics look like imagine printing them on sandpaper, that's what your going to get.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, until it breaks
Reviews.Author: D. Schuster
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera, loved it.  Then I took it on vacation a month later.  Got a 'Lens error' in my window and it doesn't work.  Piece of Garbage!

Reviews.Title: Low Quality for Price
Reviews.Author: C. Haskell "cad"
Reviews.Content: I had owned a Nikon s210, when it broke and was not covered under warranty and Nikon wanted almost $100 to repair the camera, I decided to just spend $50 more and upgrade to the s220. Bad decision. I took the camera to Vegas with me. I thought that I had taken some really good pics. I got home to look at them and only half of them came out. Most of the problem was that the pics were out of focus, or blurry. And, the "auto scene selection" option never seemed to pick the right one, and even in "auto" the pics stilled turned out bad.I was having this problem with the previous Nikon s210, which is why I sent it in for repair. I was hoping by upgrading that would fix my problem, needless to say I returned the camera right away, and will never buy another Nikon product.

Reviews.Title: Don't purchase
Reviews.Author: C. Clarence
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 3 months and it has already started to give problems. Not a good buy!

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: R. Prince
Reviews.Content: This camera is terrible. Grainy images, abnormally bright colors make many pictures appear as if out of a cartoon coloring book. Picture quality is just low all-around, with some of the poorest sharpness I've ever seen even with close-ups. Occasionally, there are fantastic shots; I've noticed outdoor, sunny shots look the best. Shots in the shade and indoors are poor. All of this even at auto flash settings.I bought this camera for my honeymoon and I regret it. I'm returning it tomorrow. Do yourself a favor and forget this camera.

Reviews.Title: did not meet my expectation
Reviews.Author: M. Lu "Mom of young kids"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small camera which can be kept in my bag all the time. So I ordered this one, the size is perfect, the camera looks very cute. However, it takes really bad pictures, never clear when it is dark outside or inside with normal light. I tried several setting and no improvement at all. The only condition that the pictures are acceptable is outside with STRONG sunshine and the object you shoot is VERY close to you. So I decided to return it.I am not a picky customer at all. I have ordered hundreds of items from Amazon in the past several years, this is the 1st time I return an item.I guess I was unlucky this time to just receive a defective camera. If Nikon made all cameras like this, it would be out of business soon.Thanks to Amazon.com, the return of the camera was very simple with free-shipping. I have received my full refund, which was quite fast. I have no complain at all in returning the item.I ordered another camera from Amazon, which is $70 more than this one, the new camera works perfectly. I am happy now.

Reviews.Title: Horrendous picture quality... on par with old Nokia phone
Reviews.Author: Donald H. Yip
Reviews.Content: This camera is great looking and a good portable size - "cute" would be the word to describe it. But when you see the images from the camera, you will be appalled, especially given the price of the camera. I got mine nice and cheap, but looking at the prices at various stores (saw it for $200 in one) there is no way the price is justified. I compared the photos from my s220 with my Nokia 6500 Slide 3.3MP phone, and I kid you not, the quality of the photos is the same. I love Nikon SLR cameras (I have a d700), but they really need to improve the quality of their compacts. Until then, I am never buying a Nikon compact again.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Larry L. Blackett
Reviews.Content: Was not very happy to find that this camera didn't have A memory chip or carrying case as the one did, my son bought at Costco for the same money.

Reviews.Title: Color on Display is AWFUL!
Reviews.Author: Sam Sora "samsora"
Reviews.Content: I am sorely disappointed with my new Coolpix.  I have a very old one with which I was quite happy, but I wanted to upgrade to a much smaller, higher MP camera.  This camera seemed like a great deal for a 10MP slim camera with VR.  The problem is that white walls & Caucasian people look yellow or orange with this camera.  I haven't yet printed any photos or looked at any on the computer, but on the camera, most photos look awful.  I will update y'all once I have printed a few of the photos & see if it is simply a bad camera LCD, or if the photos are really that awful.  If it is simply the camera LCD, well, I can live with that.  If the photos are as awful as they look on the camera LCD, then I will be returning the camera to Amazon ASAP.

Reviews.Title: Not good!
Reviews.Author: Mari T "Mari"
Reviews.Content: I bougth this camera on Feb 15,2010. Supossedly I ordfer a new camera. I did not get a new camera, I needed it for a present. The pictures look streched. I was embarrased with my friends and they were embarrased to let me know that my gift was no good! Now I cannot exchange it 'cause the return period is expired!!!! I got stuck to a non working camera and I paid $113. Before you order make sure you ask questions! I did not ask anything 'cause I trusted amazon.com since I never had problems with the items I bought before! Read, learn and ask!

Reviews.Title: slippery little thing
Reviews.Author: David R. Greene "rock-it man"
Reviews.Content: The USB connector won't work on the recepticles on the front of a computer, you have to plug it in one on the back.  Plus this thing is really slippery, watch you don't drop it.  It takes adequate pictures.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Dresch "Dresch"
Reviews.Content: I thought this camera was decent based on other reviews, but after owning it for a while it is really sub-par. Save your money for something else. It just does not work correctly or as indicated. It takes ok video, but the pictures are not very good quality and it's impossible to force changes to some picture settings, particularly night. I get better pictures from my 3 megapixel cell phone!!! Can't believe I wasted my money on this POS.

Reviews.Title: Nikon's Big Joke
Reviews.Author: B-PAX "Brent"
Reviews.Content: This camera is so bad, I can't believe it hasn't been pulled from the shelves. I work with digital cameras and wouldn't give this to my worst enemy. Buy the Canon SD780 or SD1200 IS instead. They actually take great pictures!

Reviews.Title: POOR PICTURE QUALITY
Reviews.Author: poonski
Reviews.Content: I am very upset with this camera, i loved the price, but i couldn't justify the poor picture quality. I have own several different cameras before, but Nikon s220 is by far the worst one in my list. I am taking this back to the store tomorrow.  I am really disappointed with this product.

Reviews.Title: Bad movie maker
Reviews.Author: Lukasz Kutrzeba
Reviews.Content: As I appreciate Nikon brand this time there was a disappointment. I bought this camera to shot some pictures but also to be able to make a short video shots. Well, after couple videos it appeared that the camera records poor quality videos especially in outdoor conditions where there is a lot of bright light. Recorded video had half screen yellow with pink straps and the rest of it was with a normal color.Pictures taken with this camera are OK, although AF could work better. Automatic scene selection works fine but I'd prefer more manual setup. So, overall the camera performs well, besides this movie making aspect which in my case was pretty important. That was the main reason for which I have returned the camera to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Bhargava
Reviews.Content: The image quality of this camera sucks.  Battery life is also poor.Only good thing about this camera is its style.  The lowest endCanon camera's at least produce good quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Never got the camera
Reviews.Author: Beth Chumbley
Reviews.Content: I never got the camera and I have been trying to get a hold of the seller and the customer service at amazon to get back with me. I never even got my money back. I got the camera chip 3 weeks ago but nothing more. I order the 2 together so I know the address is right. Some one contact me so I can get this resolved.
